description:
Got very thirsty on a muggy Saturday afternoon and decided to hunt for a boba place in Chinatown. Got the Just Peachy and Lychee Love and both were very refreshing and had a slice on lemon in it! The music is great and the sound system is booming! 


Update: Came back again on Saturday and had the Roasted Milk Tea with Tea Jelly, which is actually Grass Jelly. Soooooooo good!!
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
In, out, and slurped up quickly. What's not to love about a boba joint who can deliver that? 

Steap stands for a myriad of things: steeping tea, the 'tea' homophone, and perhaps most importantly, how ridiculously steep the hills of Chinatown are. Just off the well-worn tourist path on Grant Avenue hides Steap, which feels like a teeny-tiny studio apartment bursting with flavor. It's a bit of a hike but it's pretty rewarding when it comes to thirst. There are dozens of drinks on the menu and it appears all of them are high quality.

The mango paradise drink is awesome. It's so fruity and light that it'll make even the gloomiest of San Francisco days brighter. I got mine with a large helping of honey boba, which while plentiful, were hard to fish out of the ice because of its competition, the mango cubes. Steap is very good about maintaining sweetness levels -- 75% sweet should not taste like a sugar bomb, as it often does at other boba places. If you're particularly picky about being able to taste the different flavors in your tea instead of sweetener, Steap is the place to get that. 
   
WiFi here is fast and doesn't require a password, thankfully. But it's way too loud to work here, because the staff blasts music like it's the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium. It was largely EDM when I visited, which is not kind on the ears when reading spreadsheets.
author: Gwen W.

description:
I was excited to try their drinks here after seeing the pictures and cool innovative menu names. But I guess I expected too much. 

October 13 - Sometime around 8pm. The main disappointment was that the boba was not good. It was soggy and had no chew nor any taste of being marinated in honey/sugar. It was very similar to the boba you can buy at the supermarket and make yourself. If I had known, I would not have paid the $0.50 to add it to my drink.

At $6 for a large sized drink, anyone would expect it to be good. I ordered the Matcha after the cashier's recommendation that it was made out of real whisked matcha powder. While it was good, it does not compare to what I could get at boba guys for the same price point. Also, the bad boba really downed the quality of the drink as a whole. My friend also got the lychee drink and said it wasn't good.

Maybe it was an off day for them.. but I don't think I would be coming back.
author: Tina O.

description:
Disappointed. 

What I tried:
*Roasted milk tea with tea jelly
*Thai tea with boba 

Overall thoughts:
*Not sure why this place has such high ratings.  Disappointed that I was convinced to come here after seeing 4.5 stars. 

*Our drinks were pretty bland and lacked tea flavors. The Thai tea was not your conventional Thai tea. Although the menu tells you the ingredients, which warns you it's not your ordinary Thai tea ingredients, it just did not satisfy us. The roasted tea was same. Not your ordinary roasted tea and lacked tea flavors. Both drinks however were sweetened well. 

*I give this place 2 stars because the boba and tea jelly was not bad. Maybe milk drinks are not the specialty here and I shoulda went with a fruit tea drink. Sadly I don't think its worth it for me to come back to try. My bf rarely does not finish a boba drink (even if he doesn't love it) but he just couldn't finish this thai tea
author: Sarah W.

description: I tried the Almond Milk Pearl Tea with cream topping (cheese tea).  It was my first time trying cream topping but definitely not my last!  The boba was perfect and fresh, and the drink was a great blend of flavors without being overly sweet.   The employee explained to me how they made the cream topping in-house by combining whipped cream, mascarpone and then sea salt to finish it.  It added such a good savory element to my drink.  I wish I lived in California so I could come back to try their other toppings like lychee, hibiscus, hemp drops and activated charcoal!  How cool!  The interior was calming and I really enjoyed a peaceful respite here in the midst of a busy day in the city.  It inspired me to find a cheese tea (cream topping) back home near me, so thank you!
author: Emily A.

description:
This is my go to when I'm working in Chinatown. The girl at the counter is soo nice! 

Mango paradise: 5/5 
Omg I love this drink, it's so refreshing! I added aloe Vera to it for .50 cents more. It's not too sweet, but it is quite pricey! My drink was 5.50 for a large drink. 

Even though it's a little pricey, it's still worth going!
author: Elsa W.

description:
I was really excited to try this place since my friend and I heard so much about the CBD tea. When we arrived we saw the green queen drink posted on the screen and asked a few questions about this. We were described the drink and was told that they use hemp oil drops. My friend and I were pretty much whatever at that point and got the drink to say that we tried it. The drink itself was honestly whatever, although it does make a pretty picture with the powdered marijuana leaf (slightly misleading though...) In regards to the taste, there was nothing too memorable about it and for $10 I expected more than 6 drops of oil .. 

Overall, I wouldn't order this drink again. I may come back and try their other drinks if I'm in the area, but wouldn't make my way out to Chinatown for this.
author: Stacey Y.

description:
My friend and I went to Steap to try out their CBD boba that we heard so much about. I had a few questions about their Green Queen Hemp drink, and the cashier told me that they use Hemp drops, but previously used CBD honey. I wasn't sure if the effects were the same and a little confused but ordered the drink anyways cause I drove all the way here. 

The flavor was pretty good, I could taste hints of the weed flavor throughout the drink. My favorite part of the drink was actually the cream top they used! Really rich and creamy! But for the price I paid, I guess I expected a little more than just a weed flavored drink. However, if they in the future decide to go back to CBD, I would definitely give it another shot. But for now, I would just stick to their regular drinks without the hemp drops.
author: Michael L.

description:
Loudest boba place ever.
Don't call yourself a cafe when no one can properly work there. I'd recommend other bubble tea places nearby with much better ambiance and equally good tea, such as *** cool tea bar*** and *** boba butt*** love!!

It's like a human repellent here. The base from the radio make sure that you can hear your own thoughts. Even after I kindly asked them to turn it down, it's still loud as hell!! Oh wait, maybe they didn't get my request bc it was too loud??
The wifi doesn't work either


It just shows a lack of concern for the customers!

Bottom line- grab and DASH!! not a place to linger

****Update***** even with the response from the owner, which seems like a personal attack more than anything, it still doesn't change the fact it's life as hell. No matter it's under the speaker or elsewhere. Mind you, there are 2 powerful speakers in the hole in the wall. So you can't escape!!
author: Chloe Z.

description: Pretty good bubble tea spot in SF's chinatown. The place isn't big but it's long. They have bar style seating and pretty good wifi. A lot of people stop by here to do work. I appreciate how they have a bathroom! Drinks were good, no complaints!
author: Flora L.

description:
Swanky boba spot!!

Right down the block from Chinatown's Stockton street, you'll find this modern tea bar nestled on a steep hill (teehee). Very accessible by car and public transit.

This tea bar offers outlets and wifi, as well as eight bar seats and two bar tables. I wouldn't come with more than one other person, although this seems like the spot for students to come after school! They play top 50s music and has a playful vibe.

I got the "Green Queen Hemp" with contains seven drops of CBD honey on top and crisp matcha stencil of a cannabis leaf. It had a foam top and you get a free topping weekdays when through Yelp! I will definitely be returning to try the Lychee Love.
author: Navila H.

description:
I thought steap was really only ok. It was more like western boba, with prices to match. Way more expensive than your local boba joint! I tried the cbd drink and I do not think it was worth the amount of money it cost (ok maybe just to say you tried it.) It did have the cbd flavor but I highly doubt it is enough to actually relax you. The drink was almost $10 with no boba. The flavor was only ok... the lemon made it weird. Also they would run out of the foam and you have to wait forever for them to remake it. All in all, I would say pass on this boba place for the most part.

I will say that I tried steap before when they had a little stand at the ferry building. When I had it there, it was much better.
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
Not exactly sure why this place has the rating that it does -- but if I had to guess it would probably because the service completely outshines the product itself. I was greeted by girl on staff who had such high energy and was literally the LIGHT of this shop. 

As I was taking to one of the cashiers, (asked him about how business was going, how long they'd been open, etc) he made a comment to say "y'know we know there's this stuff out there but we're just trying to so the same, but a bit higher quality" and for ALL my SF natives/boba lovers, you would totally understand how much of an insult that is to comparable flavor (if not better) and lower price point shops such as Cool Tea Bar or the new Hanlin Tea shop in chinatown.
author: Julia L.

description:
After some delicious egg tarts from Golden Gate Bakery, Steap Tea Bar was next on my list for a refreshing sip. I had the lychee love which came with lychee jelly. It was very refreshing and full of lychee and fruity flavor. I really like how the workers here put their passion and time into making their customers satisfied. My boyfriend had the black tea with milk and boba. 

There are a few tables here so you can chill and a restroom in the back. Overall, I like this modern yet simple boba spot. Great service and ask for recommendations if you're not sure what to get.
author: Rita L.

description:
Steap is a pretty modern boba place in Chinatown! They play decently loud/hip music: I think I'd be slightly annoyed with it if I was trying to have a conversation here (because I'm old and cranky).

They have your typical boba options + tons of toppings, along with some specialty CBD drinks (!!!). They also have a clean (gender-neutral) bathroom, good amount of seating, and free WiFi. The password is displayed above most of the outlets among the wall. 

So I got the Black Milk (black milk tea + boba) -- a medium is $4.50 and a large is $5.50. For some other drinks, a medium is $5.00 and a large is $6.00. This place is pricey! Above the average compared to other boba shops, and spending $6 for just a large drink (although it does include toppings) is ridiculous to me. 

The boba was soft and chewy, a good texture, with slight hints of sweetness each bite. I found 25% sweetness to be the right amount. However, I was unimpressed with the milk tea: I didn't think the tea taste was strong enough or present, and it was watery and not creamy enough to me -- tasted more like sweetened tea-flavored water. Boba to milk tea ratio was slightly off since half-way through my drink, I ran out of boba.
author: Anthony T.

description: Oh Yiiis. The most famous Cannabis Tea bar in Northern California. The signature drink is the lemon + matcha taste CBD boba tea. I had the house drink for multiple times and the staff was a very bubbly girl who would always add extra CBD honey into the drink I ordered. The drink tastes minty and soothes you after you drink it.
author: Lulu Y.

description:
Really disappointed in this business's practices, misleading customers into thinking their Green Queen (or was it Queen Green?) drink has any level of CBD in it. For the record, they use hemp seed oil not CBD oil due to a health code violation (this was told to me by their cashier). I guess previously they were serving CBD but have decided to not publicly let their audience know and still capitalizing on this idea/previous marketing. 

From the start...
I walked into this cute boba shop yesterday around 3pm. It was busy but not so bad, there were still some seating options. My friend and I played with this ipad display on their wall (it will take a boomerang like video for you) and began to wait in line. There was about 7 or so parties ahead of us but the line moved fairly quickly. 

While waiting in line, I asked 2-3 questions to the male worker about the Green Queen drink (there was 3 workers total, 2 female and 1 male). I came here just for that drink after some of my friends told me about it. I asked "how many mg is in each drink?" "can we add extra CBD oil?" His responses "it's about 10-15mg of CBD in each cup" and even added that I could add an extra dose for $3 or add it to any drink for $3 if I didn't want the Green Queen drink itself. GREAT! I was so excited! 

We waited and get to the front of the line to order. My friend places theirs and I go second. I asked if they could add extra CBD to the drink and my cashier informs me that it isn't CBD, they cannot sell that bc of health code violations, and that they use Hemp Seed Oil...ok...so why did your employee tell me it was CBD oil less than 5-10 min ago? Why do you have a matcha marijuana leaf design on the cup? Why do you not publically advertise anywhere on your website that you no longer serve CBD? Why are you misleading your customers? 

...I was really confused...

Here's my issue...
Google Steap Tea Bar and the first few articles is about "CBD Boba" or, vice versa, Google  "CBD Boba" and Steap Tea Bar will come up. They have many articles about their CBD boba and how they add CBD oil to their drink. I couldn't find anything that told me they recently switched to hemp seed oil. (Additionally, their employee confirmed it was CBD oil the day I was there, yesterday.) 

For those of you that do not know, hemp and marijuana are NOT the same thing. The plants are in the same "Cannabis" family but aren't the same plant nor do they hold the same "medicinal" properties to it. Think of hemp like cotton, usually it's used it to manufacture clothing, paper, etc. Yes, there is hemp seed oil but the only nice thing about hemp seed oil is that it'll give you some omega 3's. 

Marijuana contains THC and CBD. THC is the stuff that makes people "high" and has the psychoactive effects people associate with marijuana. CBD is what holds the "healing" properties people speak about and gives you a "body high" that basically feels like your body is relaxed (no psychoactive effects). 

Once I learned that it was hemp seed oil, I obviously didn't want the drink anymore. Why would I pay 9bucks for a drink (11 ? for a large) I could get for $3-5 somewhere else + just take a fish oil pill for the same effect? 

However, my bigger issue is, why would I want to support a business that is lying to their customer base? I saw at least 3 cups of their "CBD Boba" drink in the store while waiting. Did the cashier proactively tell them it was hemp seed oil? 

Personally, because there's so much hype and news coverage around their CBD boba, I believe they should proactively tell the community they no longer serve this specific drink. Put a sign up, add a one liner to your website, tell your customers if/when they order, etc.

Very disappointed because the employees were very kind and a lot of their other drinks are fairly prices and sounded delicious. I just can't support a business that straight up lied and continues to lie by not educating their audience properly of a change. I did tell the cashier that I didn't appreciate being mislead or that their employee told me false information. She apologized. What else can she do? Sad the owners would put an employee in that position to have to lie and deflect.
author: Cindy M.

description:
Steap is definitely worth a casual detour. 
So when my life was spoiled and living in SF I had many boba options. I didn't discover Steap until a bit later in my SF boba game where I've spent most of my money at I-Tea. Steap is a different catergory. I've only have their floral, fruity drinks and they're mostly all superb. 

 I've tried: Lychee Love, Southern Sweetea, and Pink Kitty. 
Lychee Love was fresh and fruity.
Southern Sweetea is not a favorite since it seem sort of soapy in a way, not into it.
Pink Kitty is super cute and super yummy. Especially with lychee jelly. 

Most of the time it's not busy but sometime there's random rush hour. I had pre-order mine on yelp and when I got there it wasn't done (which I'm cool with waiting) but they were nice enough to upgrade my drink into a large size. Very accommodating. Chill place, good service. Good to go when I'm in Chi-town for my bakegoodies.
author: Quynh Nhu D.

description: What a cute boba shop! Lychee Love Tea was amazing! I was quite surprised to taste so much of the lychee compared to other places I tried! This drink was sweet and refreshing. Boba was soft and chewy.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
I came because because I saw a huge line of people waiting to order. I don't necessarily like waiting in line, but if there is a lot of people, you know this place has to be good. Once I reached the front of the line, I ordered Lychee Love ($4.50 for a medium) with Boba ($0.50). 

I was slightly disappointed with the small cup size, but the drink made up for it. I could taste the tea and loved the thin lemon slice in my drink. Fortunately, the lemon did not overpower the drink. The boba pieces were a little small, but they had a honey flavor to them. My drink had tons of toppings.

It was nice I could hardly taste the ice even though my drink was cool. 

I can definitely imagine myself coming back and being a part of the long line that can go out the door. It's worth it. :)
author: Kristina M.

description:
Cheese tea in Chinatown? Yes please! 

The service was honestly outstanding--I'd be back just for that. They were really helpful and authentic, not fake. 

I like how he WiFi password is clearly displayed, which is different from most tea or coffee places I've been to recently where I've had to ask. It's also great to work out of, minus the many Chinatown tours that stop by for tea tasting. 

There's a check-in deal where you get a free topping, so the cheese can be free! What a steal! 

I tried the lychee love with a cream top and it was creamy and refreshing. I like it better than Happy Lemon. Will be back when I'm around Chinatown.
author: Lizzie S.

description: Decent boba milk tea with high prices. Not bad but not amazing. We tried the regular, taro and matcha. The matcha wasn't mixed in that well so there were powder chunks. I definitely prefer Asha's tea house matcha lattes more.
author: Sophia L.

description: The vibe was cute at this place. I got the signature drink with almond milk and match a. It was a little watery for my taste and I've had better textured boba! It was worth they try, reasonably priced, and friendly staff. I would give it another chance. It sounds like they have some interesting drinks there! I just wasn't super impressed by my drink.
author: Raquel F.

description:
Ugh, another entire weekend spent sitting in my office chair. This isn't what my 20s are supposed to be like.... Anyway, in an effort to do SOMETHING (anything!) that was sitting at the office, I took a quick walk (and found out it was a "steap" walk uphill ahahahah okay no) to Steap Tea Bar. It's on a pretty hidden street and was empty when I walked in, but a line of 4 quickly formed as soon as I started ordering.

Being a matcha fanatic, I got a matcha milk tea. In my mind, there's Asha's matcha latte...and there's everyone else. This place was middle lower, but it's a high, high bar. The matcha was a bit powdery / thick, but it had that distinct slight bitterness that makes matcha yummy.  Pearls were slightly sweetened but could be a bit more soft / chewy. 3.25/5. Either I look like someone who hates sweets drinks (maybe?) or their drinks are default not sweet because my I feel like my drink could have used a bit more sugar (and I NEVER say that).

Customer service totally on point-- I had grabbed a couple drannnnks for my roommates and they asked me how far I was going to walk and wrapped all my stuff in a bag on a tray. 5/5 customer service! Also they speak Canto here :).

They've only been open for 2 months, so Steap Tea Bar, raising my boba cup to your success! I'll be back for more flavors.
author: Nicole H.

description:
I'd been craving boba tea for about a week, but too lazy to do anything about it. I decided to finally walk my lazy butt over to Steap Tea Bar yesterday, Tuesday, April 24th around 2:15pm.

I got a Large Black Tea: cold, no milk, no sugar, with Boba and Tea jelly ($5). I normally get grass jelly, but they didn't have it, so I figured I'd try the tea jelly. It had a lighter, more gelatinous texture, but it fulfilled that craving without the herbal note grass jelly tends to provide. The tea itself was pretty good. I like strong teas, so it wasn't too light for me. The boba was soft with a nice chew.

It was pretty dead when I got here. One couple sitting down and another placing their order. So it was pretty easy and quick getting my drink, unlike some more popular spots where you have to wait forever to even get to the cash register. Plus, there was room to sit and chill if you wanted. They have a row of seats along the wall and a few tables closer to the front. Service was excellent. The person helping me was very friendly and sweet.

Good option for boba if you find yourself in this area of Chinatown.
author: Elena N.

description:
Steap Tea Bar is located on Sacramento Street in San Francisco Chinatown.

I finally got the chance to visit this place after numerous attempts.  It was mid afternoon on Friday, so it wasn't too busy.

The staff were very friendly and helpful as I studied the menu while in line.  I ended up ordering a Just Peachy (Peach Black Tea) with Aloe Vera.

While waiting, I took a seat and enjoyed using their free WiFi.  It was also nicely air conditioned, which was nice on an unusual warm day in the city.

The wait was short, and I got my drink.  It was delicious and refreshing.  I will definitely have to make a return visit in the near future.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
This is the first bubble tea shop I've visited in SF, and it didn't disappoint! Granted I have nothing to compare it to, but I was happy with the options and quality. The interior is simple with free WiFi. And the lady who took my order was surprisingly welcoming and friendly too. 

I ordered the Taro Milk Tea, and the boba had a good texture. Would've enjoyed more sweetness but it's not a deal breaker. Being that it's SF, I found the prices to be fair for what you get. I'll definitely be back with the nice location in Chinatown and the free drink after getting 10 stars (spend $30).
author: Brandon S.

description:
I really like this boba place! I got the black milk tea and the peach tea with aloe Vera. The black milk tea sufficed my craving for milk tea, but the tea was a little watery and bland. It tasted good, but only so much. The boba was such a good consistency though, I loved it. The peach tea was very refreshing and the aloe vera chunks were very fresh tasting and delicious. 
Only four stars because the price is a little steep. The place also had cbd matcha tea, which is a cool thing to try, although I didn't get the chance to try it out. The price for that was also $8... so wowza LOL. 
They have like three tables and this cool photo booth to make a GIF you can send yourself, which is cool. This place succeeded my expectations!
author: Lilan N.

description: Great spot for some refreshing fruit teas. They opened 15 minutes later than usual so we had to wait outside a bit. We tried the pink kitty, mango paradise and lychee love and they were all refreshing and delicious! Definitely a great spot if you're craving something tropical.
author: Anh N.

description:
Steap had pretty good drinks.  The quality was great and the service was FANTASTIC.  It's quite narrow of a space, so I do wish there was more seating areas...but for a take out drink spot, I liked it.

Roasted milk + activated charcoal; 50% sweet

I was excited/nervous/awkward about getting activated charcoal, but nothing much came from it.  

As the milk based drinks were great, I would really like to check out their fruity drinks as well
author: Lyn C.

description:
Taro milk tea with a cream top. Thank me later. 
That Is all. 

Make sure to check in to get that free topping!! I think this is some of the best boba I've ever had. I wish I could go back and get more because it was so good with that salted mascarpone top. I got it iced but a fun tip--try it hot! The boba keeps its shape and it's really neat and fun to try when you're used to cold boba drinks.
author: Hayley G.

description:
They're totally willing to remake your drink if you don't like it!

First time I went, I tried Mango Paradise. I got a large and added boba. The drink is Taiwanese green tea with mango juice syrup and fresh lime. Very refreshing, and their boba is chewy and sweet.
I've also tried the Lychee Love with boba (extra fifty cents) - Taiwanese jasmine green tea with lychee juice syrup, fresh lemon, and lychee jelly.  I got it at regular sweetness level, and it wasn't too sweet.

They also have a GREEN QUEEN drink that includes CBD honey- but you can get it with non marijuana sugars if you prefer. Pretty tasty. 

Drinks are pricey, but so is boba everywhere nowadays. They use topnotch ingredients, so it seems more justified.
author: Josephine L.

description:
We were wandering around Chinatown looking for some boba/tea and came across here. Between the hustle and bustle of Chinatown, this spot is very modern and chic. The drinks also looks so pretty from all the colorful flavors they have here. Unfortunately, the drink I chose was OK at best. I had the Hello Kitty ($4) with Aloe ($0.50), which I was excited for as a lover of strawberry and lychee. The flavors were so subtle that I felt like I was drinking some citrusy, sweet drink which I can't even pinpoint the flavors. Their pieces of aloe was also hard to suck through the straw.

It was a refreshing drink for the walk around town, but just lacked flavor. Also tried the Purple Rain ($4) that my friend ordered, which was just okay too.
author: Cindy Z.

description: Great if you're looking for slow service with hip-hop music so loud you can't hear yourself think nor place an order without repeating yourself. Tea is good, but atmosphere is not.
author: Shawn H.

description:
The Green Queen!!!
!
!
!
Matcha Green Tea Sweet Creamed and infused with CBD Honey!
~$8 at Steap Tea Bar 
!
!
CBD: (Cannabidiol)is a non-psychoactive component of the cannabis plant:
+anti-inflammatory
+digestive aid
+eases pain +stops bacteria growth
+anxiety stress relief
-no high, but relaxed
etc......
!
!
!
Cool new item!!!

Hella pricey tho. But I get why.

PS love your new tables and the hooks for hanging bags!!!!
author: Jray M.

description:
Stumbled upon Steap while wandering around Chinatown. The cereal milk tea stood out immediately and I needed to try it.  They have three different types, one with lucky charm like marshmallows (what I got), cinnamon toast, and cocoa puffs. To my surprise they fit through the straw! I got a regular sized drink and had mixed feelings about it. The quality of tea seemed decent, but I didn't care for this specific flavor. Tasted like cotton candy. I added boba with the free topping Yelp check-in but wasn't a fan. The pearls were quite smaller than normal and were flavorless. Texture had the right amount of chew though. Also the cereal just floats so you have to either fish for them or deal with having a bunch of it leftover after you finish the tea. Drink prices here are around $4-5 at the time of this review.

Looks pretty and seems like a cool idea, but didn't really deliver for me.
author: Brian G.

description:
I stumbled upon this place while walking around Waverly Place in Chinatown. So glad I did! Great customer service and such a chic spot. They serve CBD so I got the Green Queen CBD. Gorgeous drink and she even asked me if I wanted it sealed or not if I wanted a picture. So clutch.

The drink itself was the right amount of sweet and oh so lemony and great.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Stumbled across Steap Tea Bar while wandering across Chinatown. One of the better boba/tea shops Chinatown has to offer, and though it's not a bad shop, it kinda just ranks as an okay for me.

Mango Paradise with Lychee Jelly ($4.50)- I enjoyed the drink, and I could definitely taste the subtle notes of mango green tea. Though the mango green tea taste wasn't super potent, it was pretty refreshing.

Lychee Love ($4.50)- Really weak lychee flavor, and while I didn't hate it, I don't think I'd get this again, as I could barely taste any lychee in the drink. Most of the lychee flavor that I did taste was primarily from the jelly, so I was slightly disappointed in that.

Pink Kitty ($4.50) - Supposedly a mixture of Strawberry, Lychee, and Lime, to me this tasted a lot like pink lemonade/sour cotton candy. Though refreshing, I don't know if I would come back for this again.

Service was very friendly and approachable. Even after messing up my drink order (they gave me the wrong toppings for my first drink), they gladly redid them, even though they seemed backed up by other orders.

Free Wi-Fi, charging stations, and an adorable photo station nestled by the front corner of the store, which honestly helped push the rating from a 3 to a 3.5 leaning towards a 4, though not quite at that point.

Steap for me would be a 3.5 leaning towards a 4. While I do appreciate the quality ingredients used in the drinks here, flavorwise I wasn't particularly excited, and it doesn't really compete with my personal favorite drink shops. However, not a bad shop to stop by if you're in the mood for a drink!
author: Allison O.

description:
This is based on the green queen cbd infused matcha with marscapone cream.

Yes! Go go go! If you're unfamiliar with cbd, this will not make you high nor impair motor functions. This is straight up heightened mild relaxation in a cup. 

The flavor of the marscapone with the cbd matcha was actually really good! Creamy & earthy herbaceous texture from the matcha ...I would order the drink even without it( I'd prefer it with the cbd)

The service was great! The woman,  I'm assuming owner working the counter was amazing and full of personality, music blaring and really just my type of place for a quick hydrating pick me up. 

While we were there, a fifteen person party showed up and they put up the drinks ultra fast. So I know they can rock it! I really hope this place does well enough to open multiple locations and I would definitely love to see more cbd infused drinks, I trust they could create a unique menu that pairs !
author: Megan K.

description:
Steap Tea Bar has unique drinks!

Their menu includes a number of tea options that you can choose from.  Be sure to look out for the signs, screens, and their Instagram for special drinks that they offer.  The drinks here are priced around $4-6 and on M-F, you can get a free topping by checking in on Yelp!  They also have a loyalty rewards program so you can get points for your drinks.  The staff are friendly and the place is very clean and modern.  There's a decent amount of seating and free wifi.  They also have a photo printing station that used to print out photos that you tag their Instagram with, but now it creates an animation.  My drink is usually ready quickly, but it does get busy at times!

Some of my favorites are the roasted milk tea with grass jelly, the lychee love, and the purple rain.  The roasted milk was really good and I finished it in less than 10 minutes, so I have to order a large next time.  The grass jelly was easy to drink as the chunks weren't too large.  The lychee love is also very refreshing!  Purple rain has butterfly pea tea in it, so it results in a pretty purple-pink color.

I'm not a fan of Tony's tea, which is a green lemon tea with mascarpone cheese top.  I don't think the cheese and lemon should go together.  It tasted like a sour yogurt drink.  I actually couldn't finish it and threw it away, which I never do to my tea!  What a disappointment :(

I wish their sealing of the cups were more secure and strong.  Some of my tea got all over the film lid.  Also, I would probably adjust the ice level if you could.  Overall, pretty solid spot with delicious tea!  Definitely still trying more of their menu!
author: Stephanie Z.

description: I found out about Steap Tea Bar when they first opened because they followed me on Instagram. I've been wanting to try this place out and I finally got the chance to during my latest visit to the city. I ordered the lychee love and added boba to my drink and my bf ordered the roast milk tea with boba. For both drinks we got less sugar and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. Both drinks themselves tasted decent but the boba was over cooked and on the softer side. There also wasn't that much boba in the drinks. Not sure if they were running out of boba but they should have been prepared with another batch. I wasn't really impressed and I don't think it's worth the walk through the Stockton tunnel to get here from Union Square. There are plenty of other boba places in the city that I prefer.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Cool little boba joint in Chinatown!

We were in the mood for boba after getting dim sum nearby and we decided to yelp a place.  This place stood out more and had better reviews than most of the other boba joints in CT.  So we came here and it was a good first impression - the place was really nice and it felt so new too. There was good music playing and it wasn't crowded.... YET.... we ordered our two drinks - I got the Just Peachy and the gf got the Lychee Love tea.  I got mine with chia seeds and it was a great combo! On such a hot sunny Saturday, these drinks really did hit the spot.  Right after we ordered our drinks, sat down, a HUGE crowd came in after and the whole place was packed! I can't imagine if we hadn't miss the crowd.  Parking in Chinatown is kind of hard and it depends on your luck if you can get a good metered spot.  But as of now, there is a lot of construction going on in the city so it really might be hard to find a good parking spot closeby.
author: Ben Z.

description: Steap Tea Bar contacted me and offered to refund me for my drinks since I wasn't satisfied. Thank you for the generous offer and excellent customer service. My family and I were there with 2 toddlers (ages 4 and 20 months), we were busy chasing them around and did not notice the 100% satisfaction signs. We will stop by again next time when we are in town to give it another try! No refunds necessary. Thank you again
author: Natalie T.

description:
Really had high hopes for this place due to the awesome reviews and location. Service was great. Decided to change a drink after we ordered (same priced item) and they were able to accommodate. However, drinks just tasted bland and watered down. I had the roasted milk tea and ordered several other drinks. 

Wish I was able to give this place a higher rating. Should you decide to come here anyways, I would probably recommend increasing the sweetness level to get more flavor.
author: Tina S.

description:
I take it back!! I'm flip-flopping. Emil won me over today. My first review was strictly for the MealPal experience, which is all valid - however, today my company was having lunch catered and I really needed to use up my meals so I rather lose out on some of the value and get something than let my meal go to waste so I decided to give this place another chance - especially since the owner had taken the time out to respond and offer to make it right. 

Today's offering: Roasted Milk Tea with grass jelly 

The store had one customer ahead of me, and I showed my phone and silently waited for my drink. Emil was working at the counter and started asking whether I wanted something different than what was being offered on MealPal. I responded with no, it's okay. He started talking to me about MealPal and said that there had been a review and I cut him off and said "HI SORRY THAT WAS TOTALLY ME".  Instead of being upset with me because I had wrote a meh review, we got into a conversation about my perspective as a consumer and I explained to him how MealPal worked and why the regular sized drink isn't the best value option for someone on MealPal. During our chat, he said "Hey, I said I was going to make this right and said I'll give you a free drink so tell me what you want."

Genuinely surprised that he remembered everything I wrote and what he said and offering me the free drink when I didn't even bring it up. Instead of dismissing me, he wanted my feedback and see how he can make my experience better. I chose the Mango Paradise and added aloe. Emil insisted that the barista making my drink give me samples so that I can taste my drink and make sure it's truly perfect before he'd let me out the door. My drink came with ice this time and a slice of lime inside - It's the perfect blend of mango and green tea. (The first time was made by a girl with no ice - and no lemon) 

I'm super happy that I gave it another chance. Emil is genuinely so nice and try to talk to his customers to understand how to better improve. So while the regular size is definitely not worth my MealPal meal - I would definitely go again if I was in the situation where I absolutely had to use up my meals and didn't want food.

I'd definitely go and buy the drinks as a regular customer.  Solid A+ for customer service, I normally don't go to bubble tea joints for customer service since I'm used to Asians screaming my number when my drink is ready, but this place is above and beyond. 

I learned that they have a rewards programs via Square - Every $27 you get $6 off? Or something like that...

TLDR: Give this place a shot! Excellent customer service. They really will remake the drink for you if you aren't happy with how it tastes.
author: Judy H.

description:
A little hard to see at first, since its just on a random hole in the wall along the bustling Chinatown businesses, this boba/drink place offers a hip vibe in and trendy feel in between the bustling shops.

That being said, the drinks were not all that great. I ended up getting the Lychee Love with Boba (it already comes with Lychee Jelly) and I wasn't all that impressed with it. The green tea felt a bit weak in flavor, and the lychee was a little light. The lemon they added with it actually kind of takes away from the taste of the lychee, and it wasn't all that great of a combination.

The boba itself is rather boring, and I don't think this place is really known for it. It was chewy in some forms, but it wasn't all that flavorful or sweet, lacking the honey boba taste of many places in the area, as well as the nice well made execution of say Boba Guys.

Overall this would be a pass in my book. They do have a rewards system though if you like it here, it's kind of presented at check out.
author: Tyler T.

description:
First of all, this shop was on the alley of Chinatown which was pretty easy to find. The workers here are pretty nice and dope. 

I came with my friend, she got the "lychee love" and I got the jasmine milk tea. It was really tea-y and flavorful, which I really like in my Jasmine MT. My friend got the lychee love so said she liked how the lychee went well with the tea so compliment each other really good. The drinks were lowkey expensive ($5 for a medium, which is kinda small). 

They had some other drinks too and a great place to sit down and chill with friends. The only downside is that you might have to find parking. Overall, I would come here again and try the matcha drink!
author: Katrina Y.

description: After stuffing our faces with dim sum nearby, boba is always the best move after a nice meal. We walked into this shop and it was pretty busy. The line was long and I saw quite a large selection of flavors. The shop has a really modern vibe to it and is a great hang out spot in the Chinatown area for a boba stop. The staff was very nice even though the shop was busy. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone really needing some boba in the area.
author: Jarvis R.

description: I tried Steap Tea Bar for the first time last week, and I can wholeheartedly say that this is my new favorite boba shop in the city! Their menu includes many different fruity and milky choices. What really caught my eye was their unique toppings, which included activated charcoal and cbd honey. They also have the original toppings of boba and jellies. I chose the lychee lover drink 75% sweet with aloe, and it was super refreshing on a hot day. The workers were friendly and helpful, they even offered me a sample. There is free wifi and a good number of wall outlets, perfect for getting work done. I can't wait to come back to try their other drinks!
author: Nancy C.

description: Very underwhelmed. As a boba connoisseur, I really wanted to check out this place given the 4.5 stars on Yelp. I came on a Saturday afternoon, and the place was popping - lines were pretty long the entire 1-1.5 hrs I was there. I got the Lychee Love, 25% sugar, and didn't really enjoy it. The tea and lychee flavor were weak. My friend got the same Lychee Love but at 50% sugar, which tasted slightly better, but nothing too amazing. Prices are also quite steep. If I end up coming here again, I'll probably try another fruit drink, 50% sugar, or maybe I'll shell out $9 for the cbd matcha drink, since you can't really get that anywhere else haha
author: Erica T.

description:
We love Steap so much we used them to cater dessert drinks for our wedding!

Emil kicked ass!  He came in early to set up, laid out all the drinks beautifully, and took the time to explain the drinks to folks who were unfamiliar.  The drinks were a huge hit!

I highly recommend them for catering events. Their prices are more competitive than Boba Guys and of course the drinks and boba are AH-MAZING!
author: Josie M.

description:
Another boba spot in Chinatown SF! The tea was good (I got the kumquat green tea), but they ran out of boba mid-day (they had out another batch in, but it was like a 20 min wait). However, they compensated by offering any other toppings for free :) This act of kindness, brought this review up from 3 starts to 4. 

As I left the shop, I wondered to myself why I had only gotten one topping (chia seeds) if they offered unlimited toppings for free????? What was I thinking lol?
author: Vasiliy M.

description: Probably my favorite boba spot in SF Chinatown. Located on Sacramento St., it's a good distance away from the YMCA, Union Square, and other great places in SF. The venue is small, so I wouldn't recommend it as a hang out spot. Prices are decent for the drinks. If you come here, try the Almond Milk Tea! It's my favorite here and I find it to be creamier compared to other AMT's I've had elsewhere.
author: Danielle M.

description:
It's good but not as amazing as you'd expect it to be given the reviews. Definitely overpriced (starts at $5 for regular milk teas). The flavor is good but too sweet and the colorful appearance make it fun which is probably why it's pricey. They don't use fresh taro for the taro drink. Not super friendly at the counter either. I've been here twice and each time left feeling ripped off.

The check-in free topping is only worth 50 cents (even thought that's not mentioned in the check-in offer)
author: Misty M.

description: This place is hip for Chinatown, but tasty. Not much of a hangout area, more of a grab and go. Definitely be sure to consider the sweetness level you like, I typically prefer a less-sweet boba and the staff are super friendly and happy to get you exactly what you want.
author: Marsha M.

description:
I recently moved to San Francisco, so I have been exploring the boba scene. 

Parking: Paid street parking 

Ambience: There are 3 small tables (w/ two stools) and a long bar table (w/ 7 -10 stools). It is a great place for working because there is free (and fast) wifi and charging outlets. 

Service: The person who served me that day was great! Shout out to her. She was friendly and was genuinely happy. :) 

Order: Kumquat Green, $5.00 for M and $6.00 for L: I adjusted mine to 25% sweetness - perfect for me. You could taste a good amount of kumquat with underlying flavors of green tea. The boldest flavor was citrus (there was a slice of lime). The boba was perfectly sweetened and chewy. 

Verdict: 5 b/c of the great service, boba, and working environment. I would recommend this place if you want boba and/or need a place to work at.
author: Michelle B.

description:
A modern boba shop in china town, fortuitously located next to a park. It's decently pricey.  They have some interesting flavors. 

The inside is modern and minimal. There's usually no line. Service is pretty fast. 

I ordered the kumquat green tea which was solid.
author: Sean W.

description: Another check off the list of the popular SF boba teahouses. Though this place has prob become more popular in the last few months because they serve a cannabis drink. I'm a little curious to try it but don't really want to buy a while drink because I'm not sure if I would like it. Anyways I got a medium mango paradise with boba ($4.50). Boba is good, chewy and cooked well. The drink was ok. I got it less sweet (25%). Their standard sweetness is already 50%. But I still liked the less sweet option.  It could've used more tea flavor. But the lime in there was unique. They tout that a lot of their ingredients are organic - milk, sugar, fruit, etc. I would come back to try some of their other drinks. Also they are located on a hill so be prepared when walking here.
author: Alison W.

description:
First time here.

Drinks are not to sweet!

They gave us a taste so we could sample it. We got it a little sweeter than their default.

Got the roasted milk tea. The grass jelly was refreshing!
author: Jenny L.

description:
I'm new to San Francisco and new to the boba culture, but this place really is the best in SF. There's also a barista there who's really cute and adorable, and he's always super nice to me and all of the customers.

I think the mango paradise with peach flavoring is really good, especially with the CBD oil and lychee jelly.
author: Joshua O.

description: Stopped by while I was in Chinatown looking for something refreshing to lift my energy. The pink kitty definitely hit the spot! Slightly citrusy, strawberry, and lychee all together is a great summer combination. Try this if you're here!
author: Alicia W.

description:
I love this place! 
My friend and I was around the neighborhood (YMCA) and stumble upon this wonderful shop! 
We ordered 2 regular milk teas and the staff is soooooo nice! 
I like how they gave you a sample if you're concern about the sweetness. 
Most places start with 100% (like ughhhh no thanks diabetes), but this place starts with 50% (which I love because I can't stand too sweetness) 
The boba is smaller (by 5-10%, but I don't mind) because the texture was soft enough and chewy enough! And the sweetness is just right as well! 
AND their ice is REAL! It actually melted! Unlike other places I notice the ice stayed.... uhhhhh when I don't finish my drink I leave it in my fridge, the next day, the ice cubes are still there, like all there! 
But this place, your ice is real! 

I can't wait to come back to try more
author: Fiona B.

description: My husband and I spent some tea time here. I ordered hot Tony's Green Tea. My only complaint is that the tea is not strong enough to be called tea.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The tea shop was nice and clean inside so that's a plus. However, the green tea was soso. There is nothing that makes this place stand out (especially since they don't even have their claim to fame the CBD drink as confirmed by the cashier), and for the price it's not worth it to me. Maybe I should have ordered the fruity drinks or whatever but for just boba green tea, that price is not justifiable.
author: Oliver C.

description:
Amazing customer service paired with some yummy drinks - what more could you ask for?

My foodie friends were all raving about this place so I decided to check out one day when I was in the city. Since I've heard about their great service, I thought I'd ask for some samples of the drinks. Specifically, I asked to sample the matcha latte and the jasmine milk tea and the staff happily made us some samples to try. He even offered extra samples to the other customers in the shop. 

Although originally we were only going to get 1 drink, we ended up getting both the matcha latte and jasmine milk tea because they were both so good! Strangely enough, different workers made the drinks for us and they just were lacking in taste and were terribly diluted and poorly made. We had to ask the original staff member to remake the drinks for us as he had made the samples. He gladly remade them but we definitely felt bad. I'm giving 5 stars for the good customer service, but I do think something should be done about the consistency of the drinks based on who's making them.

BONUS: If you make an Instagram and tag Steap Tea Bar while you're there, your photo will print on their machine and you can take it and keep it!
author: Catherine S.

description:
How is this place not more mainstream????????? *scratches head*

It's actually one of the more solid boba joints in San Francisco. I had my hesitations about this place at first because I thought it was going to be another store that used powdery, fake milk tea. 

When I walked in, I was pleasantly surprised by everything - from the interior decor, free wifi and seating, bomb ass music, and boba drinks. Even my friend, who is ridiculously hard to please, agreed that it was a boba store with lots of potential. They have interesting flavors, which you can tell they put a lot of thought into, like the charcoal flavor topping. It also tastes very authentic - reminds me of boba in Taiwan, which is hard to replicate in the US. 


I want this place to be popping because it's definitely a place to try and it sucks that not more people are getting their boba fix here. Perhaps their soft opening was not as successful, but Steap Tea is definitely a place that is equally competitive as the likes of Boba Guys, Plentea, and Purple Kow.

So... if you're drinking quicklys or equally shitty boba, you need to try this place.

Thank me later yelpers.
author: Emily F.

description: Very great service and good tea. I got the honey green tea. I don't really prefer the organic honey taste though. It's definitely different.
author: Lanny N.

description:
My review will be summarized short and concise as "bland af".

Tried matcha milk tea and almond milk tea with boba. Both drinks barely had flavor, barely had sweetener, and the actual boba itself wasn't very fresh and guess what?? Also bland!!

Will not be back.
author: Kris C.

description: Go try Steap special " Green queen CBD" they have some CBD oil inside , after u drink , u will feel very relax, must try ..........
author: Bella S.

description:
A nice milk tea shop in SF Chinatown! Finally! I usually have concerns with a lot of Chinatown boba shops being too dirty or with their tea tasting mediocre. Fortunately, I don't have to worry about that here because the place is definitely welcoming and CLEAN. It's a little small, with few tables and a counter/bar (with outlets), so sitting around here isn't ideal for big groups.  

Matt, a friend and boba connoisseur, and I ordered the Lychee Love and Roasted Milk Tea. The Lychee Love does taste like its name, but man, it was way too sweet, and that's coming from a person who loves sweets. I think it's from the lychee syrup, and the lychee jelly is even hard to sip through the big straw. On the other hand, I loved the Roasted Milk Tea and would totally recommend this. The roast flavor was so strong that it punches you in the face every time (Matt's wise words). My friend and I kept alternating our drinks so that the initial taste of the strong Roast flavor would hit us hard, and then we would cleanse our palate with the Lychee drink. We kept repeating that. 

Bottom line: Roasted Milk Tea. I am sold.
author: Sarina C.

description:
# 16 (of 42)  Steap (not Steep) *Rod Boba SF area Rating * 5/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars

Just as I recently bumped down a place I had ranked highly to a lower tier after subsequent visits. I decided to bump Steap "up"  (from 19/30) after I gave it another shot. 

The owner Emil seems very committed to customer service and after mentioning my subpar experience the first time he had me taste test the milk tea again before I walked out of the facility which is always a nice touch. 

On the note of boba which can often be the  differentiating factor for myself and a lot of people this place changes out their boba every 3 hours (according to Emil)  which is above average and they seem to take pride in it when other venues seem to take little pride in it and it shows in their taste. 

The milk taste was better this time and I have it at a 5 now and the boba was also better which I gave a 6.  This place is elevated to  #16 in my SF rankings below and goes from an afterthought to a solid venue to get boba in my eyes. 

Rod M tours San Francisco area in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  I have a more comprehensive Tiered list (101 boba spots and counting) for boba places as well.  

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #42  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible

author: Rod M.

description:
Tried: mango paradise (2/5) and thai milk tea (2/5)

We stopped by Steap after seeing the long, long line for Boba Guys. While it has high reviews, it definitely did not live up to our expectations.

The mango paradise was extremely bitter and had no real mango flavor. My friend drank less than half before deciding to cut her losses and throw it away. However, if possible, the thai milk tea was even worse. The milk tea tasted extremely artificial (lowkey ironic considering how they market all of their drinks) and had none of the strong tea flavor.

Both people at the counter were nice, but I definitely won't be stopping at Steap again considering the options nearby.
author: Hannah H.

description:
Not usually a fan of fruit teas, but the Lychee Love and Mango Paradise were really good. The drinks were not too sweet and not filled with an overwhelming amount of ice. They were refreshing, I would definitely order again!

It was our first time there and we didn't know what to order, but Erika was very patient! She even offered us samples of the boba since we couldn't decide what toppings to get. 

Also there is free wifi and lots of outlets to charge your phone or laptop.
author: Joey W.

description: The boba was fine but the teas seemed a little less authentic than I would hope for a chinatown location. I also chose from the decaffeinated section which wasn't the most appealing.
author: Christopher And Michelle C.

description:
Love this new boba shop that popped up in chinatown. Right when you walk in you can tell this is a quality boba shop that really cares about the ingredients that go in their drinks. Nothing is from powder, and they make most everything in house including toppings like their jellies and boba. 

They have a selection of fruit flavored teas, milk teas, and also non tea drinks. I went with their most popular fruit tea.. The mango green tea and added their house made grass jelly. Their teas are actually a lot less sweet than other boba shops which I really like. Less sugar = less guilt. You can adjust the sugar levels but their normal is like 50 percent sugar at other boba shops. 

If you want to sample a tea just ask them. The servers are really nice and ask if you want to sample anything. They also have random samples made right when you walk in the door. Also if you don't like how your tea turned out, you can ask them to remake it to your desire

I liked my mango green tea a lot!  The tea flavor comes through!  The grass jelly was super soft and flavorful. It almost melts in your mouth!  

One of my favorite things is that they have this awesome photo booth feature where it prints out photos you upload to Instagram using their hashtag #steapteabar.  How cool is that!  

This place also has a table with bar stools and outlets at every station if you want to work/study there. It's a great space to hang out work.

Will definitely come back and try out more flavors
author: Suzanne W.

description:
I really dig the drinks here at Steap. They use quality local milks for their milk teas. Their roasted milk tea is really good but my favorite is the charcoal almond milk tea with boba. You don't really taste the charcoal but it gives it this great grey color. 

Steap also offers non-tea or decaffeinated drinks, in case you want something caffeine-free. Their Pink Kitty and Purple Rain are my favorites. 

Lychee Love is a non-milk drink that uses green tea - really yummy. They also make something with passion fruit that is good, too. 

I really like that they make their toppings in-house. They make their boba every three hours or so so that it's fresh. Its a little on the sweet side, but I like it! The texture is great, too - a little dense and really chewy. 

The decor is nice and simple. Plenty of seating (wish I could say the same for parking). Great music. There's even a photo printer inside and free wi-fi! Service is excellent- Emil and Ericka are super friendly!
author: Rose A.

description:
Got a craving for boba tea and you're in Chinatown?! Come here! Free wifi, charging stations and great drinks. After walking around all day we needed a place to rest our feet and to grab a nice refreshing drink. 

After seeing all the great reviews we knew this the spot. Service is great! She walked us through the different types of drinks and most popular choices. They even offer samples of certain drinks to help you make your final boba tea decision. I was debating over fruity drink or milk tea. I ended up with the matcha latte with grass jelly. Loved it! It wasn't chalky or powdery. And they make it with almond milk love! I always ask for milk substitutes whenever possible. If you had authentic matcha you know the taste difference compared to a syrup or other matcha flavoring powder. This was authentic match powder. Grass jelly was nice and soft. My bf had their roasted milk. Also really great flavors! Very smooth and creamy. No artificial sweeteners or chalky powder residue. I really liked that that start their sweetness levels at 50% less already. I didn't have to reduce the sweetness level at all. 

It's a long narrow space with bar seating against the wall with charging stations. It was well kept and clean. Bathrooms were very nice and clean. Really enjoyed it here. Defiantly one my list of boba spots to come back to on our next visit.
author: Karen H.

description: good price for what it is ig. i got the almond milk pearl it tastes decent, but a little funny, not like normal milk tea but it's okay. the boba was warm when it finished making, which is good (i really like warm boba for some odd reason). med for almond milk pearl is $5, large being $6. if you like it i recommend getting the large bc the med is a little too small for my likings.  would go again if very close or desperate for milk tea‍ 3 stars!
author: Banana S.

description:
We came in here as a group when there was only about 20 minutes until closing. We were greeted by the friendly faces of Erika and Alexandra. Man, Erika does a pretty good "Ni Hao" in Chinese and she knows every single thing you could possibly know about the tea in there. I was seriously so impressed. 

I got the roasted milk / creme drink and I loved it! Almost everyone in my group had a great experience, had fun dancing to the music, and enjoyed the service and humor from Erika and Alexandra. Seems like a fun place to work and a fun place to be. More comfortable seating inside would have been nice, but I understand if it's not that kind of place.
author: Jake A.

description:
I was at the SF Matcha Fest when I saw the Steap booth among the many matcha drinks booths (I guess there's not much other than baked goods and drinks?).  I wanted to take the opportunity to try Steap, since I still haven't made it to their Chinatown location.  Also, eating a lot of heavy matcha snacks makes you thirsty for something cool and refreshing!

I ordered the Green Queen, since my lactose for the day was done at 4:00pm.  This was a mixture of lemon, matcha, mint.  I was a little apprehensive about the drink since I've never tried that combination before, but I was pleasantly surprised at the flavor.  It tasted like a very refreshing non-alcoholic mint mojito.  I wanted to try the CBD cream top but there was no way I was going to pay an additional $3 on top of my $5 drink (I could probably buy an actual mojito somewhere for that price....).  

I really want to go to the Chinatown location and try their other popular drinks when I'm not lazy!
author: Shirley C.

description:
If I could give the customer service here 6 stars out of 5, I would. The customer service from the two female staff were incredible and they were extremely knowledgeable about their drinks and toppings. They made the boba tea selection really fun. 

I found it funny that they have toppings called charcoal and butterfly pea topper. I didn't try it, but apparently their toppings make their drinks more picture-worthy.

Overall, I think the drinks were OK. The basis of the sugar in the drinks is 50%. So maybe that was why it wasn't as good for me as the drink in other boba shops. 

If I could offer a suggestion, I think there should be a big banner at the front of the store that says STEAP or something because if you were just wandering around Chinatown, you would completely miss the store.

TL, DR: Awesome Customer Service, OK Drinks.
author: Victor L.

description:
Came here with a few friends. Drink came out quickly. I got the lychee love with boba and lychee jelly and a tea jelly. Toppings were pretty stellar. I thought it was interesting they had activated charcoal as well. Drinks almost seem like they're healthy for you lol. I could drink this stuff everyday.

Cleanliness: (5 stars) uber clean spot.  

Service: (5stars): Erika and amo are super friendly and they asked if I was 100% satisfied with my drink or if I'd like any alterations. This place is fantastic 

Drinks (5 stars) very high quality ingredients. Everything is organic. Absolutely no powders and simple syrups are made fresh. The tea jelly is made everyday fresh.

Overall cool spot with legit drinks. I'd def come here again! I suggest you try this spot out if you enjoy teas and boba!
author: Mel S.

description:
Steap, not to be confused with Steep in SOMA (mehhh), is a modern boba spot in Chinatown unlike its nearby competitors because they offer a variety of fruit-based drinks, not powder-based, and are customer centric non-Asian owned (I think?). They offer interesting toppings like the "pea tea" which turns purple when interacted with lemon, and coconut shavings. I like that they also have almond milk. 

I loved my matcha and would definitely come back for it - it was strong, flavorful and delicious. The boba was satisfying and well cooked, not super chewy but good nonetheless. Compared to Boba Guys, my gold standard, the tea is good because it's super strong and flavorful and they're less stingy about the boba. 

The black tea tasted like homemade Lipton with milk. Would not recommend. 

Boba Guys wins for having an overall stellar menu of items, but Steap is a great alternative because they have a more varied menu and their matcha is delicious!
author: Jess C.

description:
It's been a while since I've tried a new milk tea place. 

I nearly thought Steep down in SOMA had a second location. The quality of the milk teas made it seem like the case.

As of yesterday, I have now been to this location 3 times, and is now my main alternative for tea near my workplace whenever iTea has a long line (which is nearly all the time now). One of the things I noticed about this place, other than the immaculate space for seating, is the clear windows on the counters, which allow you to see the ingredients and tools used in making your drinks. This is a huge contrast to your average milk tea places, as they usually make them in a separate room, or on the counter with partitions to hide what they're making. To me, this sends a message to the customer that the ingredients at Steap are indeed freshly made and drinks are handcrafted. Any milk tea business can claim fresh ingredients, but Steap is not afraid to show it. 

My usual go-to drink is the....*looks at menu right in front of me at my desk* Almond Milk Pearl ($5 for 12oz, $6 for the 18oz cup), which consists of Taiwanese green tea, almond milk, non-dairy creamer, cane sugar, and boba. There are multiple points where you can modify your drink, from amount of sweetness and the type of sweetener used (cane sugar, honey, or regular sugar), level of ice, type of milk used (although if you go with the aforementioned drink, you sort of have to go with almond milk, right?), and toppings. 

I opted to go with agar boba in place of regularboba, and loved the result. The flavor and the level of sweetness were perfect to my tastes. No powdery taste at all. And while the price point is a little more expensive than at most places, the freshness more than makes up for that. 

Oh, and they actually encourage patrons to send their drink back if there's something you don't like. They are actually WILLING to make it again for you! Amazing!
author: Viet N.

description:
$6 for a Large milk tea with tapioca. Taste like sugar and tear. Tapioca was subpar since they were not even chewy and stuck together. My straw go clogged and rendered it useless. 

Go down the street and check out iTea down the block on Montgomery st. It's way better than this place.
author: Vince Z.

description:
I walked into this place and thought to myself...here's just another tea place too modernized for its own good. I was thoroughly impressed with Steap. I had the lychee love - jasmine green tea w/ lychee syrup, jelly, and lemon. This drink literally filled the craving that I have been trying to fill for a couple of months now. The jelly was perfect, the tea could have been a smidge less sweet, but other than that - I am completely smitten with Steap. 

I was sorta in a daze - but brewers were friendly and overheard that they would make samples of teas to assist in making a decision.

$4.50 a drink seems to be pretty standard nowadays. I guess this price is fair with the quality that comes with these drinks. I'd have to admit that this is a pretty cool addition to SF's Chinatown.
author: Jennifer W.

description: After the disappointing sweetheart Cafe, we came to this place for kids' bubble tea redemption and it does not disappoint. Boba tasted how it should be
author: Ethan H.

description:
Just went here for the first time and I was very satisfied. Very modern looking, but it's a place that's more suited for takeaway, due to the limited seating. Of the seating that is there, there are power outlets for the hipsters who like going to coffee/tea bars and sitting down on their macbooks.

The tea was very delicious. I had the roasted milk tea which was very tasty, and the tapioca was very chewy and yummy as well. The price was pretty standard for your bubble tea shops (~$5).

What really impressed me was the customer service. I was offered a small sample of the milk tea after it was made so that I could have a taste in case it wasn't to my liking. In addition, they  will remake your tea without question if you aren't satisfied with it (I definitely didn't need this though). Lastly, I ordered a medium, but my drink was upgraded to a large for free! It was a great gesture (even though I felt extremely guilty drinking all that milk tea). Very friendly people work here, and I'd definitely come back.
author: Desmond C.

description:
Best house made tapioca balls!! Best Boba!! 

Enjoyed stopping in and getting a refreshing beverage. Friendly staff, clean bathrooms for customers.
author: Andrew ß.

description:
Such a cute little modern boba spot located in SF's Chinatown. To be honest, this is not the type of establishment I was expecting to find in a chinatown, but that is a good thing. It's very clean and the people are very friendly and inviting. 

The menu has a variety of drinks to choose from such as milk tea, fruit tea, or herbal teas. They give you recommendations according to what you feel like having at that moment. It's awesome that they give you a small sample before they finish up your drink to make sure the sweetness level is to your liking. 

Like usual, when I know that I won't be back anytime soon, I get 2 drinks. I went for a Jasmine milk tea with boba and purple rain with basil seeds. I got both of them less sweet, and that was perfect for me. The milk tea wasn't too milky like some other places. That allows you to taste the flavor of the tea. It was very refreshing! Their honey boba had the perfect texture, not too soft and not too hard. The purple rain was good and refreshing as well. I didn't care for the basil seeds too much. They were a little different. It was a bit too hard. Perhaps they weren't cooked all the way through? Do you even cook basil seeds? I don't know, but I can do without them next time. 

I would like to go back and try the pink kitty next time!
author: Lily T.

description: Steap tea is a tiny hole-in-the-wall right at the beginning of China Town. I walked into some pretty smooth jams and the staff was super friendly, I had about a million questions since they have some exotic tea flavors and they were patient with me. If you're looking for a classic milk tea, get the Black. They also offer CBD Honey Shots ($3 a shot, and 10mg per shot) and it went well with the black milk tea. I've honestly never seen that before, first time at a boba shop!
author: Angella G.

description:
I went to Steap after seeing pictures on Instagram!  I couldn't decide what to get but owner helped me out and hooked me up!

I got Kumquat lemon, not lime, with hibiscus on Ice small size is $4.5.  It was very tasty and wish I did get the Larger size.

It's a small shop with counter seating with outlet & WiFi and maybe a small table near the window.  

There is a photo machine, if you hashtag your IG pic you can get your Selfie printed out!  That's very cool.

One unisex bathroom in the back.
author: Ann L.

description:
Came here during the CNY fair. The workers were extremely friendly and knowledgeable of their teas. We tried samples of their almond milk tea and mango tea. Sadly, the great customer service wasn't enough because the execution of the drinks was just meh. The taste was just OK. I spent $5 on what would be a small at Quickly's for something that tasted like jasmine green tea. 

Hell yeah their prices are STEAP. Iono what those questionable 5 star reviews are talking about. There's better boba elsewhere..
author: Sydney C.

description: This place has a "health food" mixed with boba aesthetic. They offer an add on of charcoal powder which seemed very popular with the teens. The Pink Kitty tastes like a healthier melted popsicle, very refreshing in a hot day. The prices are a bit steep, or should I say steap. But the taste is very clean and refreshing without being cloyingly sweet. I would definitely return if I am back in the area, maybe I'll even try the charcoal add on.
author: Ellen G.

description:
Best tea bar in Chinatown by far in the 21st century!

Already felt eager to head to STEAP Tea Bar that Friday evening.  Rain or shine, I'm still in a mood to try handcrafted artisanal milk tea on my very first visit.  My first cup straight from the"Build your own" menu: ice free chia-chai!  Of course, I get to choose what I put in a plastic cup that suits my fancy.

Herbal: chai
Sweetness level: medium
Sweetener: cane sugar
Milk option: almond milk (I'm lactose intolerant)
Topping: chia seeds

I had to skip step 3 which contains fruit flavors, less of course you had to be a rocket scientist and choose a lychee flavor to the mix and it might taste weird.  Anyway, my chia-chai is remarkable and impeccable!  Know why the tea flavor is appropriate to its topping.  Aside its light and smooth cup, notice the difference between my chia seeds and everyone's favorite pearls.  Mine float at the top of my drink while their pearls sink at the bottom like sunken treasure.  I wasn't much of the fan of bubble tea.  If blocks of ice didn't get in my way, I still end up taking the last of the pearls.  Here's another thing to let you know.  When I tried to sip the last content, I suck the air from the plastic cup, making it crumpled before it reforms back to its original shape.  Reminds me of VITASOY.  Plastic cups in STEAP Tea Bar are recyclable.

I love to go back to STEAP Tea Bar and buy another!  Its atmosphere feels very modern and warm welcoming.  Customer service is outstanding and one restroom is acceptable to anyone.

I'm looking forward to see if they have limited time only special flavors. :-}
author: Jimmy C.

description: I love all the different combinations of flavors with boba you can get there. It was hard to choose! But for my first time, I ordered the mint julep with boba - mmm! It was refreshing and flavorful! I want to try the sweet tea boba next time. I'll be back for sure! Love boba!!
author: Maile N.

description:
Oh how delicious, oh how tasty. I'm Seriously delighted every time a take a sip or even get a whiff of my steep tea.

Amil has sourced the most exquisite blends of fragrant satisfying teas from Asia and all I can say is thank you! 

The care that goes into each cup they hand craft for you will resonate internally with you all day long 

Yes! Yes! Yes! 

Best tea shop in SF no doubt!!!!!
author: james p.

description: I loooove bubble tea and really enjoyed the tea here! They offer some inventive twists on the usual varieties - I ordered a Moroccan mint bubble tea and a roasted tea milk bubble tea. They also have a good selection of toppings including aloe vera, boba, lychee jelly, and "tea jelly", which is the large jello-like blob of jelly. Definitely worth a visit if you are looking for some top notch bubble tea in the Chinatown area!
author: Kelly B.

description:
This place is legit good. The vibe of the shop has a modern minimalist aesthetic. I got the Pink Kitty which is green tea, strawberry, lychee and lime. I added lychee jellies for 50 cents more. I also got half the sweetness which turned out perfect. The staff was very friendly, the drink was refreshing and flavorful without being sickeningly sweet and the price point is unbeatable. On top of that, their drinks just look really appealing and begs to be posted all over IG. Can't wait to come back and try their other drinks. 

5-stars for yummy tea-based drinks that you can customize to your liking.
author: Joan S.

description:
The Jasmine milk that I ordered isn't the taste that I expected at all.. The Jasmine milk was not sweet enough & the boba was hard as rock. It feels like I'm drinking milk more than Jasmine. I barley taste any tea either. 

Pros: 
- Customer service (You guys rock!) +1 
- Atmosphere +1 
- Efficiency +1 
- Short line +1 
- Smiling faces +1 

Cons: 
- The Jasmine milk itself overall -2

Overall, it's not the best Jasmine milk I've had. But it's certainly not the worst either. I got a large for $6.00 which is really pricey. A little bit disappointed, but it was ok. If I have a chance to come back, I'd come again next time to try another drink.

Update: The manager contacted me regarding my review. +1 for customer service. I will be back if I am in the neighborhood. Thank you for the follow up!
author: Jonathan Z.

description: Taro bubble tea was good and the yelp free topping was great. Good place and free WiFi also.
author: Kandria L.

description: Super nice staff, clean store and easy to find. One star off because 5 dollars for a small milk tea is a bit too expensive.
author: Kathy M.

description: Very good drinks. Fast service too. Would recommend to anyone after eating dim sum at Hang Ah Tea Room..
author: Angel R.

description: Great spot for boba in Chinatown! My wife and I both got the Jasmine Milk which was good. The tea flavor was just right and the boba tasted like they were freshly made. Will definitely stop by next time I'm in the area.
author: Josh L.

description:
Y A S 

I think Steap is one of my favorite boba places in SF now (tied with Boba Guys).  For one the line is not horrendous and they use high quality ingredients.  Interior is small and minimal, perfect for grabbing some boba while you explore Chinatown.

They're quite generous with their toppings, and you can definitely taste the quality in their teas.  They use local organic milks too - one of the few boba places that I know of that offers organic almond milk, so woo!  They also have some interesting trendy toppings I haven't seen at other boba places like activated charcoal.

Wish they had a location in south bay, but I'll be back when I'm in SF!
author: Helena Q.

description:
Highlights
- Available for Yelp Eat 24 order ahead. Yes for convenience!
- Employee was very thoughtful, since I ordered a hot drink via the Yelp app, she didn't make it until I came in for pick-up to ensure it was warm.
- Service was great. Although the sole employee was in a conversation with a regular patron, she immediately acknowledged me upon my arrival and assisted me. Thumbs up!

Improvements
- Not sure if it was my cold that I was trying to fight, but my kumquat hot tea was lacking in flavor. Must give it another try to confirm. 

Tip
- A lot of variety of interesting drinks
- If you are not from the city, be prepared to walk up some hills if walking to this area. In Chinatown area, so parking may be difficult aside from street meters or parking garage.
author: Tracy T.

description:
Great handcrafted tea with equally awesome people serving it!

The hibiscus blend (2nd visit) is by far the best thing on the menu (and that's saying something because everything is delicious)! I can tell the owner puts a lot of thought into every drink that he makes. 

If I'm ever in San Fran, again, I'll definitely stop by!
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
