Boba guys was closed so I yelp'd this place and I couldn't be happier!!!!

I was immediately greeted by Erika and she gave me a bunch of recommendations AND took the time to explain the sweetness levels/ how the drinks are made / the ingredients etc. to make sure I got what I wanted which I really appreciated :-)

I ended up getting the lychee love & purple rain. 
^I LOVED PURPLE RAIN!!!!

Another great thing about the customer service here is that if you don't like your drink, they can remake it for you and adjust to your satisfaction! The owner Emil was explained the importance and meeting customers' needs SO TRY EVERYTHING!

Also, FOR ALL MY INSTAGRAMRS' OUT HERE! The photo both in the corner instantly prints out pics from your insta as soon as you hashtag n post :-)

Can't wait to come back and try more drinks!
author: jocelyn n.

description:
Steap was extremely accommodating and patient with a large order (16!). Seriously great customer service. And, all 16 customers were satisfied with their tea.

Thank you!
author: Connie C.

description: We got the matcha latte with boba and a black milk tea with boba. They were both pretty good and you can taste the quality ingredients they use. I loved the flavor of the matcha latte but unfortunately, it was really grainy. I think that all depends on the barista, but I think they should focus on really dissolving the powder because it was pretty concentrated, as you can see in the photo. It is also pricier than other places.
author: Sabrina O.

description:
LOVE this place! A friend and I wandered in at at 6:40pm and we wanted to try the CBD drinks, but they were sold out. We got a jasmine milk tea and a matcha milk tea instead, and they were both AMAZING, and we will definitely be back when the CBD is back in stock! 

What really sets this place apart is the friendly, amazing service we got - Erica is awesome! The ambience is great as well and it has a good amount of seating inside. 

10/10 would recommend!
author: Priya B.

description:
Wow! Got to try steap with my coworkers for the first time this week. Interesting assortment and variety of drinks. Appreciate them using fair trade and/or organic ingredients. 

I ordered the black milk tea which comes with tea jelly. Tea jelly was good but wish my tea was more flavorful. Regular sweetness was perfect, wasn't too sweet.

Would like to try some of the other items on the menu to see if I like them better
author: Betty C.

description:
Roasted milk tea - many good reviews about this and the nice roasted touch. I got a large w/o ice, w/ boba. IMO the roasted flavor is a lie. This was a $5 for a below ave cup of milk that has lightly touched a tea bag for a hot second. V disappointed. Would never order this again and would never recommend it to a friend...maybe an enemy.

Their boba is great though - very soft and chewy. I can't think of any way to improve it.

Prompt and average-friendly service.
They play decent music. Limited seating. Not a place I would hang out at, def more of a grab and go type of place.
author: Jeanie N.

description: I came to pick up my mealpal and the worker asked if it was what I wanted. The mealpal drink was roasted milk w grass jelly I was able to change it to boba instead. Thanks! I'll be back.
author: Jazmine S.

description: This boba place is located inside of Chinatown, and the inside decor is simple and clean. Have already heard so many good reviews about this boba, and you know what? Definitely give it a try if you are in this area and you won't regret it. I love their vivid colorful drinks - we ordered Hibiscus Kumquat Green & Paradise Mango with jelly with regular sugar and ice. Their drinks are so refreshing and delicious, and of course Instagram worthy. I just wish that the Paradise Mango could be a little sweeter, because it literally tasted like 30% sweetness. Other than that, everything was great and the staffs were super friendly to introduce us the most popular drinks in store and give us recommendations. Customer service is definitely a 5 star in my opinion here, no doubts on that.
author: Emily Y.

description: This is my favorite tea bar is San Francisco. This small shop tucked away in historic San Francisco Chinatown is easy to miss but hands down brings the worlds best tea leaves to make its teas. Great variety of both eastern and western styles they even have a celebrity chef Tony Gemigniani Pizza endorses cheese tea! I typically go with the "southern sweet tea", "the just peachy" or the "roasted almond milk" teas.  Today I'm having a roasted almond milk tea.
author: Steve S.

description:
Man.. I read the reviews and had really high hopes for this place. I ordered 8 drinks on a quiet Sunday and the milk tea was so bland! It just tasted like watered down tea with no flavor, the boba was good though.. 

I wouldn't go out of my way for watered down milk tea.

My response to the owner, Emil: 

Funny how you stated that you specifically remember that you served me when I gave my cousins the 8+ orders. I never interacted with you, so maybe your memory is not the sharpest. Just because I wrote that I ordered 8 drinks does not mean that I have to step foot in Steap to order them? And for you to say that you talked to me and discussed how you're all about satisfying your customers and having me taste all of the samples is a bitttttttt of a stretch. 

You're right, I'm not satisfied with my order and I don't know why you would feel like I'm attacking you and your business when I simply wrote how I felt about your milk tea. 

Maybe next time if I'm around the area, we can meet for the first time!
author: Tracy V.

description: I did not even get to try their drinks. After waiting in the long line for about half an hour, when we finally got to order, the lady before me had just taken the last of the boba. The baristas should have let the people know towards the middle/end of the line when they started running low on boba, rather than having everyone wait only to leave empty handed.
author: Norma G.

description:
I've visited Steap Tea Bar twice and both experiences were excellent!

If Steap were in a location with less heavy traffic I think I would make more visits. The store doesn't look like something that would be in Chinatown. The drinks are unique and the staffs there are usually welcome to giving samples.

Both visits, I was helped by the store owner (I asked for his name but forgot it already, sorry!). He is very passionate about his business. They serve high quality drinks with distinct tea taste.

Pricing is a little on the higher end. About $5-$6 a drink. The menu mostly consist of fruit teas which I highly recommend trying.

The last time I came I order the matcha chocolate. Very strange but also tasty. After go through half the drink I lost interest, so I would probably stick to the more classic drinks.
author: Sarah T.

description:
We needed another good, friendly, hipster boba place in Chinatown and now it's finally here. This place serves authentic Taiwanese-style tea drinks, and has fewer American-style crowd-pleasers than the always-packed Boba Guys a few blocks away.

I remember coming here the first two times on a Saturday and Sunday when it was completely empty, but now the third time on a hot day it is packed to the gills, so I guess the secret is out. And downtown San Franciscans rejoiced.


---- MILKY ----

Black Milk: 4.5 stars
This is a Sri Lankan black that is actually delicious (and I'm quite a tea snob). Only gripe is it gets a bit watered down as you drink it so I will ask for less ice next time.

Matcha Latte: 3.5 stars
Strong good authentic matcha, but lacks that extra something that Boba guys puts into theirs to make it a "matcha latte" that appeals more to Western palates.

Cereal Milk Tea: 3.5 stars

Cinnamon Toast Crunch Cereal Milk: 4 stars
Had it at 75% and it was nice but a bit too sweet. Might try it at 50% sweetness next time.


---- FRUITY ----

Kumquat Green: 4.5 stars

Lychee Love: 4.5 stars
Their green tea is really good here.


---- TOPPINGS ----

Boba: 4 stars
Soft and chewy, but I generally prefer it more firm.

Tea (Grass) jelly: 4.5 stars
One of the better grass jellies I've had in the US. Soft and melts in your mouth like the grass jelly served at the Taiwanese "Black Ball" dessert chain.

Lychee Jelly: 4.5 stars
author: Letitia L.

description: Great little tea shop in the middle of China town. Very clean and well maintained. Their milk teas are great and so are their fruit teas. Everything tastes super fresh. The only major issue here is the amount of ice they put in your drink. Order a medium sized tea and half the cup is filled with huge ice cubes. That leaves little room for tea and waters the drink down a lot when the ice melts.
author: Jonas G.

description:
I was in Union Square shopping with my family, and needed a break. I yelped some boba tea places in the area and decided to check out Steap based on their reviews. 

As soon as I walked in I was greeted immediately, and the staff made me feel very welcomed. The atmosphere is really cool also.

 I ordered the Mango Paradise, and it was amazing! By far, the best tea drink I've had. The quality of my drink, definitely matched the service that the folks at Steap provide.
 
When we're in Union Square, this is definitely the Tea place I'll be going to. Please give them a try! You won't regret it.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Decided to try this spot after stumbling upon a post on Instagram. If you know me, I'm a milk tea lover, always. 

Anyways, I ordered the roasted milk tea and let me just say, it was not good... it tasted so watered down and just lacked any tea taste. I ordered the jasmine milk tea for my boyfriend and he said it was just alright.. maybe I'll give this place another try next time and order one of their fruit teas instead

The cashier that rung me up that day was really nice though! It was women's day that day so I got a free upgrade to a large on the house
author: Sidney S.

description:
Great tea but at a steep price. The black milk tea is more so on the milky, creamier side. I haven't frequented the Steap enough to check out the other drinks, because of the price tag. My first visit, I left work pretty late but was determined to get there before it closed. They were nice enough to give me a free size upgrade.

The pearls also are nice and chewy and infused well w/ honey and a brown sugar syrup mixture.
author: James N.

description:
Surprising to find this kind of tea bar in Chinatown! This place is very clean and would be a cute place to just hang out. As for the tea itself, I really liked how strong the taste of tea was in their drink (I got the roasted tea) and the milk didn't make it too heavy either. Compared to a lot of other boba places, Steap is less sweet which is a huge plus in my opinion.

I also tried the kumquat drink my friend got and it was as advertised, very refreshing. If you generally don't like sour things though, this is probably going to be too sour for you though. A little bit far if you're in FiDi to visit but if you're in Chinatown, this is the place to go.
author: Cassie Z.

description: What a fun Tea Bar! The "bar tender" was incredibly kind to our group and was patient enough to explain the process and what bubble tea was. She gave us samples and was able to describe each of the drinks. There is not a ton of space, but there is enough space for small groups to hang out. A great atmosphere!
author: Nathan B.

description:
Very stellar boba tea! Came here and ordered 5 boba teas. Each and every one was fresh, delicious authentic. They also let you taste so you can check the sugar level. I love that you can adjust the sugar level because most boba places are too sweet and sugary for me.

Don't get fooled by the elegant and corporate modern décor, for everything is handmade and tastes homemade for e.g. the aleo vera. Extremely kind owner and patron (we had a great chat with him) who helped us out there and you can tell the love and care that goes into every cup. We also found out that they do catering for large parties... will be ordering from my husband's office! 10 Out of 5 Stars!
author: Tobey A.

description: I really really wanted to like Steap since they use high quality ingredients and I read a few reviews saying it was comparable to Boba Guys....but honestly I was kinda disappointed. It was completely empty on a Saturday afternoon and I expected better service than we received, which was mediocre at best. We tried the matcha latte and jasmine milk tea hoping it'd be on the same level as Boba Guys, but it wasn't even close. Honestly I'm not sure what to say other than it just wasn't that good. Their teas are definitely not sweet even at 70% sweet, which is what I usually get at other boba shops. The drink definitely wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good either. I had high expectations for this place, but until I have a better experience here, I'll be sticking to Boba Guys.
author: Alyssa W.

description: Good drinks, but the lychee jello is a little stale and hard. Other than that service was excellent and people were friendly. We like to take the gifs at the front and record hem while waiting. Thanks for a great experience!!!
author: Riley V.

description: The kumquat green tea was good with a fresh citric flavor and a lemon slice on top. That being said, I was not blown away by this versus kumquat tea drinks at other places that had more real fruit puree (eg. Asha). The location is small with some bar seating facing the wall, definitely more of a grab and go place. The décor is a bit out of place being in Chinatown but it's a good add to the traditional boba places in the area.
author: Dani T.

description:
Erica is the best. Today i brought the Tonys Tea and the Green Queen with the CBD is the best. Erica You Rock.  =) Keep up the good work .

Ill be back in no  time.

=)
author: Jacky W.

description: It's my second time stopping by Steap Tea Bar last week. I had the Pink Kitty and the Black Milk Tea. Pink Kitty was good but a little too sweet for me, I am glad that the line kind of balances out the sweetness. The Black Milk Tea had a weird after taste, it might have been due to the grass jelly. I love their creativity here and would recommend most of their fruity tea drinks. Milk tea is not their specialty in my own opinion, but their kumquat green tea and sweet tea are on point.
author: Charlene F.

description: Great tea.  It was busy but really quick. Workers are super friendly. Bathroom is clean.
author: Jesse R.

description:
The owner/one of the owners of Steap tea was there at the cash register and really helpful! 

Ordered the mint julep with boba and it tasted exactly as it says on the menu. Black tea, mint, lemon, etc Now don't go expecting it to taste like Disney's mint julep since that is completely different. 

That being said the boba was soft, chewy, and sweet. The tea was fantastic, steeped in house I assume. Nothing really to complain about. 

Also they have a booth that prints out polaroids if you post a photo on IG and use their hashtag! 

Overall would come again if I am in the area!
author: Sam T.

description: Sorry Steap, I came in with high expectations because the menu looked extensive and place was very clean. Major bonus for having usb outlets for us to charge our phone. And a free topping with check-in. But ultimately it's about the tea. I ordered almond milk tea and it was really watered down, barely any flavor. I'm surprised because located in Chinatown, you are within proximity to lots of shops selling high grade tea leaves. Boba was whatever. No go for me.
author: Wendy L.

description: Amazing service is something everyone loves and it's hard to find nowadays. Clearly STEAP provides amazing customer service and love to each handmade drink. I love how they take their time to introduce their menu to each customer and greet them as soon as they walk through the door. Their menu is really interesting but it tells you what is in each drink. I went for a large(24oz) Lychee Love with boba and the cashier(I don't recall her name) didn't charge me for it which was really nice of her. She also didn't seem grumpy, really energetic as a matter of fact. STEAP also provides free wifi and seats along the wall for you to sit and enjoy your drinks. As of now, they do not have any snacks, not sure if they will provide any in the future. I'd definitely come back to try the rest of their drinks bc it was so refreshing I chugged it all. Oops.
author: Lisa W.

description: I love the modern atmosphere and vibe that provides a great hangout space. I recently did a "best boba in Chinatown quest" and out of the 7 place I went this if #1. I got the mango paradise drink and although the flavor wasn't my favorite, the boba is nice and sweet and the menu is very varied. The service was above average and the price was good for the area. I can't wait to return.
author: Miles M.

description: Only tried the taro milk tea with cream top with less sugar, and that was great!
author: Pèi Yàn S.

description:
The best boba place I've ever been to. Small modern spot, service is incredible and there's never a line (though I want these guys to crush it so hopefully it will eventually be a line out the door 24/7). They're really generous with toppings and the drinks are always on point.

I make it a point to go any time I'm in the FiDi/Chinatown area for work.
author: Riki N.

description:
The super awesome, zealous owner deserves all the five stars here! You can tell he poured his heart and soul into this business and makes a conscious effort to actively engage with all his customers to ensure that they have a wonderful experience. 

I do think a lot of the milk teas were on the pricey end, so I ended up ordering their Pink Kitty which came out to be a total of $3 for a medium size. Refreshing and tasty concoction! Highly recommend.   

Warning for students, this is not the most ideal place to study. Although they have several outlets and free wifi, the tables were small and didn't have enough room to fit my 13' Macbook Air comfortably. Butttt if you only need a tablet or books to study, then it's definitely doable. 

They also have this Instagram picture machine I didn't get a chance to play with but looked super cool and a great amenity to this dank ass boba shop!! Would be down to come back and dick around on it.
author: Natalie Y.

description: Awesome drink and service! The lady making my drink is really helpful and she recommends Regular ice for my black milk tea w/ boba, which turns out perfect on this warm February day!!
author: Ivy L.

description:
I lalalalove this place. As someone who is commonly called an ABG (Asian Boba Girl), this is probably my new favorite place. Not just because of their drinks but also because of their superior customer service. 

I have been here about two times, and each time I got a little confused about where it is. This store has a black banner with no words on it and the only way to identify it is their little stand-up sign outside the door (which can be a little hard to see if you're not walking down/up on Sacramento where you would be facing the sign) but don't lose hope and put in the extra eye effort to find this place! 

They take every form of payment possible (Card, card, Visa, Apple Pay... ) which I love because I hate digging into my bag for my wallet and then my card. They're a part of the 5-star rewards program and everything is highly customizable here. From your sweetness level, ice level and even what type of sweetener you want (honey, cane sugar...regular sugar)

Now onto their drinks, I have tried the Mango Paradise and the Roasted Milk Tea, both of which I highly recommend. You can definitely taste the tea in their drinks and it doesn't taste watered down or drowned in sugar.

Both times I been here I got top notch customer service. They have a 100% satisfaction guarantee, and that means they will make a whole new drink for you if you are not satisfied. I asked for more sugar in one of my drink and instead of just adding the sugar in like most places, the barista kicked up a new one for me even when I was low-key begging him to just add it to my current one (like seriously, I felt bad because he warned me that their sweetness level tends to be lower than most places and I didn't listen) Second time I was here, they took a little longer than usual to make my order and they upgraded my drink to a large without even asking. (and it really made my day because I had a pretty rough day today)  

TLDR: Good tea with a high range of customization. Excellent customer service and tbh some of the baristas aren't bad looking :x
author: Jenny N.

description:
Loooove! Show this place some love even if it takes you out of your way! It's the only place in NorCal that offers PLAIN matcha drinks! Not matcha lattes, not matcha food items, and no other bs!

It's like a bar, custom made dranks or order from their unique menu! The woman (owner) running it was v nice, v friendly! Parking is a leeeeeeettle problem but 11/10 would come again!
author: Eva L.

description:
Came by again. It's a bi weekly addiction for another big order of tea to stock up the fridge with. 
Roasted Almond milk with grass jelly is the best!
author: Sharon S.

description: Got the roasted milk tea with activated charcoal. The tea by itself is really good, but I don't think the activated charcoal really affects the taste at all, I just got it more for the novelty. I like the ambiance of the place but it is a bit pricier than other places nearby.
author: Eric Z.

description:
I am a boba fanatic, I even make my own at home, but this place has the best boba I've ever had, hands down.
I ordered the toasted milk tea at 75% sweetness and oh man it was so so good. I wish I lived here so I could come here all the time!
author: Sierra H.

description:
I am addicted to Tony's Cheese Tea! It is Steap's newest amazing drink that the famous Tony's Pizza picked to collaborate with, and that's a huge compliment to Steap Tea Bar!
Plus, Erica and Emil are awesome hosts and happy to accommodate any special requests!
Let's continue to support local businesses to keep our economy healthy!
author: Yvonne D.

description: What a gem in Chinatown!! Modern, clean, and extremely welcoming. I love that the owner Emil is always there to make sure I am happy. The Lychee Love is out of this world! And the Boba... Don't get me started. It is worth the trip just by itself, but it's also the perfect post-Chinese grub stop. This place makes me love SF even more than I already do!
author: Gregory Y.

description:
3.75
I had a good tapioca phase and have been tapioca'd out for a while now.  I don't crave it and I don't seek it.  My friend likes Steap and she wanted to try the other flavors so we stopped by.

Matcha - it's very matcha-y.  a little too matcha-y for my friend.  Nice soft balls though ;P
Roasted Milk w/ grass jelly - average milk tea

There's a lot of competition here in the city when it comes to food.  I was engaging in conversation with the owner's friend about the food business and food in general and it's a tough business to get into.  Steap has a lot of potential.  Simple décor with a cool photo printing station.  Two friendly attractive guys making and selling tapioca with a smile.  Drinks that aren't the BEST in the city IMO but maybe the best in the area.
author: Linda N.

description: This is a fairly new tea bar as they have only been open about a year. Nice part of my visit was that I got to meet the owner and we talked about how he has been trying to change the view of bubble tea. I got the taro milk tea. When order the taro I would get no sugar as the taro syrup is pretty sweet in itself. Over the teas we're good and the service is fast.
author: Jackie N.

description:
Deep in the middle of Chinatown, we find Steap. And unlike most of the other boba places around it, it was founded by an American who didn't grow up drinking boba. He just found it and fell in love.

What Steap does is find a way to build off of the renaissance of bubble tea started by Boba Guys, and expands it further, bringing it to an even wider audience. Emil cares about every single cup created and wants to see it made exactly how the customer wants it. Turning it almost into a Chipotle, but for boba, it really allows you to get the drink how you want it, and is very welcoming to newer people to the drink than the more traditional boba joint is. Everything is fresh and carefully sourced, so really be creative. It isn't your traditional bar, but a place to really enjoy the drink.
author: Griffin S.

description:
My first Yelp review goes to Steap Tea Bar! I stumbled upon this place while I was in Chinatown. I was pretty excited that day especially since I had just walked about a mile to meet a friend. I tried the Almond Milk Pearl and my friend tried the Just Peachy. 

I thought that my Almond Pearl was a bit bland/too much ice. The tapioca was soft, but was a little on the sour side. Maybe the taste was a little off because it was towards the end of the day? My friend thought her drink was okay. 

Honestly, the price is a little on the expensive side (for Chinatown). For $5-6 bucks I rather just walk a block and a half to Boba Guys (organic milk and ingredients) on Stockton.
author: Bianca C.

description:
Dope spot!

Super clean environment, friendly workers, good tea, about average on price and some really chill music (heard some r&b, future bass, chill hop).

I got the cream top milk tea which was really good! They start off at 50% sweetness but I'd say their 50% is closely a 90% at regular boba shops so if you're usually ordering low sugar at other spots, I'd go for 25% sweetness here.

They also have just as wide selection of special fruit teas and something I haven't seen before, "CBD tea." It's not actually marijuana that'll get you high however a chemical compound from the same plant with zero of the high effect. There's been cases where patients have used this to cure some diseases/malfunctions through natural consumption. 

I don't know a whole lot about it besides that (and I may just google it and find out more and try the drink next time) but it's definitely the first tea shop to use it and that's great exposure for MJ.
author: Hiro D.

description: So today I ordered the CBD Green Queen, when I was paying, a girl cashier asked me if I wanted regular or with hemp, I said with hemp. When I got the drink, it was the regular one, so I asked. Surprisingly, they said that was what I ordered and if I wanted to change it, I have to pay $ 3.50 more. I'm sorry, but why the fuck do I have to pay for the cashier's fault? I said clearly that I wanted the CBD one. I was gonna take my friend her to try this drink, but not anymore. In fact, I have never seen any business that asks the customer to pay for its fault, so I do not recommend this place, and will never return again.
author: Fiona Y.

description:
Had Saturday class today and was craving for some boba. Searched around the area on Yelp and discovered Steap Tea just three streets away. After looking at the interesting menu, I decided to get some for myself and the family.

I had a total of 6 drinks so I wrote everything on a paper. The owner greeted me with a smile at the cash register. He double checked with me to make sure I was okay with the "regular sweetness" as their regular is only 50%. Yes! Most boba stores make their drinks too sweet. I'm so glad their regular is just right!

I'm not gonna go into details of what I got because honestly, everything was DELICIOUS!!

One major big plus for me though, is that the owner taste tested most everything for quality control. He even tested the syrup?! The tea is so strong (in a good way). Will definitely be back after my Saturday classes!
author: Sandy F.

description: I have been trying to get to this Boba Place since last year to be honest. It's quite a hike from my job but well worth it. The staff was very friendly, made suggestions on drinks and did not rush me. I opted for the cold organic chai which was very tasty. I love that they used all organic ingredients. The prices are roughly  $4 for a medium and $5 for a large. I would come back here again.
author: Kam H.

description:
I got lost looking for this spot because there's no sign outside . Just a foldable little sign on the floor. If the navigation said you're there, you are but it's right in front of your nose. 

Drinks 5/5
Amazing selection of drinks. More on the hipster side because they have chia seeds. I got the Kumquat Green Tea Lime with hibiscus puree pour on the top. It's refreshing and not sweet . Perfect drink for the hot weather. 

Customer Service 5/5
It was my first time there so I was overwhelmed by the menu. The owner gave me helpful suggestions as to what to order. 

I will definitely come back here again.
author: Miri L.

description: Concept is super cool and the menu options are so interesting, fun, and creative!! I'm not a caffeine drinker and they had plenty of delicious non-caffeine options which I definitely appreciate!  The cheese tea topping is AMAZING.  I basically want to put that on everything.  Clean, well decorated, and staff are super friendly, helpful, and attentive!! Lives up to my NY standards!
author: Natasha K.

description: The tea is pretty high quality! I will say the boba is not that sweet, but it tasted pretty good to me! (I don't have the sweetest tooth). It's useful to know that this place opens pretty late (at 12 pm), and is also pricey.
author: Vivian Y.

description:
I went to Steap the other day while visiting San Francisco from France. I love having a tea break with friends so I have certain expectations.

I randomly walked by Steap during my Chinatown visit and decided to stop and give a try. Amazingly surprised by the warm welcome from the staff. First of all, I found the staff very friendly (A smile is always so enjoyable) and very helpful. 

Emil, the owner took care of me. I truly appreciated how knowledgeable he is about teas. About the menu, there is a tons of options, by far the most diversified recipes that I've seen in the city. 

After asking a bit about me, he suggested me to try the signature matcha green tea with boba to let the caffeine kick-in for the rest of my day: simply Ex-ce-llent. Surprisingly, back home, Matcha green tea is my favorite so I was curious to compare. A very sweet palate surprise. Boba are top quality, just the right amount of chewiness and very flavorful. 

My opinion, must needed to visit if you really know about teas.
- Drinks are authentic and match our needs: 5/5
- Customer service: 10/5
- Atmosphere: 5/5 (love the chandelier!) 
- Efficiency: 5/5 
 

Cons: 
There is no Steap in France, yet. 

Steap, Thanks for this experience !
author: Mathieu Z.

description: Not to be confused with Steep! It's really clean, minimalistic, and mod inside. The lady was nice enough to let me sample my jasmine boba 30% sugar to see if it was not sweet/too sweet. At first try I thought it tasted kind of diluted, and I was worried carrying it back the melting ice would make it even more diluted. The boba was a bit harder than I usually like but honestly, tea and boba both grew on me. The tea is really fragrant and good, and I enjoyed the slightly harder than mushy boba. Glad I checked it out! The medium is pretty small for $5. A good size, just a bit tall in price!
author: Ke C.

description:
An easy to miss but hard to forget experience. The owner of the place really is doing a great job of making customers feel welcomed. The owner has a background in bartending and really made me feel like I was sitting at a counter just having a conversation with a friend. I think I enjoyed the experience more than the drink!

On to the drink, premium bubble tea that is really curated for you as long as you express what you're interested in. They won't sell you on the most popular but on what you like.

They have a smaller menu than traditional but the drink I had (Chai latte) is worth it.

Give this place a shot over the others around this area. I did and I'm glad.
author: Vinh T.

description:
Love their drinks and creativity. Usually the service is top notch, I work in the area and every time I've come here the owner and staff have been super friendly. 

However, the most recent time I stopped by, they seemed very annoyed and impatient. My friend and I were the only ones in the store but we both felt that they seemed agitated. I forgot to specify that I wanted no sugar which is totally my fault, I always forget to specify if not asked. They were almost done making the drink and I apologized twice for forgetting to tell them. They practically rolled their eyes and remade it annoyed. I used to work at a boba shop as well and we always politely remade drinks even if they were fully made and served already. My friend also felt like the cashier's attitude made him feel pressured to tip. I was very surprised by this past experience at Steap since they made it such a point to be friendly in the past. The owner was not at the store this time so I wonder if that's why. 

Still giving 5 stars because the quality of the drinks deserve it. I'll just take this past encounter as a fluke.
author: Andrea Y.

description:
Four stars for the drink, but five stars for awesome customer service! For the two times I've been here, the staff have been really friendly and knowledgeable about the drinks. Today, I waited in line for about 5 minutes+ because they had a large catering order ahead of me. Wasn't really an issue with me since I wasn't in a hurry but the staff apologized and gave my friend and I drink upgrades to the large size. (I've waited in long 30+ minute lines at certain other boba shops and didn't get treated this nicely!)

As a lactose intolerant person who loves going to boba shops, I was happy to see many non-dairy milk tea options on the menu. There was a great mix of fruity drinks as well as milk tea with non dairy creamers and almond milk. I decided to stick with a fruity drink and got the mango paradise ($4) with grass jelly +.50 cent toppings (grass jelly was freshly made in-store!) The drink was good, although I wasn't really a fan of the organic lime they added in which made it taste a bit less sweet and added a slight sourness. Maybe they should make that optional. Another thing I noticed was that they use flavored syrups and no bits or chunks of real fruit added in which would have made it better. Loved the grass jelly, which was really smooth and soft and worth the extra 50 cents. My friend got the matcha green tea latte, which was non-dairy. She liked it, but said it tasted a bit too overpoweringly matcha-y. However there is a sign that says that they'll remake your drinks if you don't like them, which makes their customer service even more awesome.
author: Christina G.

description:
This place is great! Not only are the drinks not too sweet, but the customer service here is amazing! If you let the staff know what sort of tea taste you're looking for, they go the extra mile by recommending drinks and modifications to help you get exactly the experience you're looking for! Especially if the line isn't too long, taking the time to chat with the staff and learn about the different teas left me feeling more knowledgable and that translates to better drinks too! Not to mention free sample :9

Will definitely be coming back here!
author: John P.

description:
Nice little shop in the middle of China town in San Francisco. After a long day out walking and roaming the city, me and my friends got pretty thirsty and we decided to check out this tea bar. The workers were very helpful with recommendations for teas based on our taste preferences. It is also customizable to how sweet you like your teas and of course whichever toppings you prefer, or no toppings. They also played really chill music and had free Wi-Fi as well.

I tried the Mango Paradise, it is a fruity Taiwanese Green Tea, with mango juice syrup, and organic lime. No toppings were added and I also didn't adjust the sweetness level so I stayed with the standard sweetness. It was just the perfect amount of sweetness and fruitiness combined together. I was very impressed with this place!
author: Jun I.

description:
Right off the bat, this is not your typical Chinatown boba shop.

This is my go to place when I'm feeling something fruity or different. When I first walked into Steap, I was pleasantly surprised. It smelled and felt clean. It was aesthetically pleasing and the staff is welcoming, greeting every person that comes through. 
Getting to the drinks. I've only tried out the Decaf/Botanical section of the menu. Purple Rain, Pink Kitty, and Hibiscus Punch. I'll have to say they're all YUMMY. Plus, it's free for a slice of lime or lemon in your drinks! 
The drinks are a bit pricey compared to other places, but to me it's worth knowing that all ingredients are organic and fresh, as well as knowing where it came from. 

Tip: if your drink has a lime in it, don't let it sit for longer than an hour. Your drink will eventually turn bitter.
author: Yvonne F.

description: I love this place. It's so fresh, not too sweet but beat of all, the service is amazing and I love the manager/ owner Tony. We love the roasted almond milk tea. The boboa is super fresh and I love the fact it doesn't taste heavy or artificial. Whenever I'm at union square, I'll go out of my way and take my friends and kids there. It's. Big treat for us. There are so many boboa teas in SF but this by far is my favorite.
author: Grace P.

description:
walking in, like the mature people we are, the first thing we noticed were the hemp drinks but after looking through their unique menu we choose the hibiscus punch with boba.

upon trying it was met with mixed opinions by the group. while i thought it wasnt quite as good the jamaica agua fresca one could get at pretty much any taco shop, it was still my favorite out of the drinks we tried that day. as you can see below however, others disagreed with me.

i would, though, like to come back to try some more of their extensive menu.

rankings
flavor/freshness/boba texture/total (out of 5) and ranking next to the 8 chinatown boba shops we tried

person a: 4.5/4/4/12.5 #5
person b: 5/4/2/11 #3
person c: 3/4/3/10 #7
person d: 3.5/3/3/9.5 #7
person e: 4/5/4/13 #3
me: 4.5/4.5/4/13 #1
average: 4/4/3/11 #4
author: Boba R.

description: Ehh the drinks here are pretty mediocre if you ask me. Pretty cool place to chill and hang out plus they have tons of outlets so you can study here. I love their inside decor though. I got the roasted milk tea with boba and my brother got the jasmine milk tea. Both were not the best nor the worst. Just didn't wow me LOL. Service was friendly. Wouldn't return though.
author: Tina C.

description: nice little milk tea place in chinatown. you can adjust sweetness levels and they let you try it before they complete your order,  which is nice.  will be back
author: Ny P.

description: I didn't bother with any of the out of the ordinary/novelty drinks. If you could do a solid OG milk tea you're fine in my book, not to mention this place is pretty central in Chinatown so I would expect the quality of tea to be up to par. What most places fail at obviously is getting boba right, but here it was pretty close to perfect. Rather than having like a brown sugary taste to it, the boba here was more so honey like (which isn't bad). What I love of about NorCal is that people are just so much nicer compared to SoCal - just asking whether or not the drinks were at a good sweetness level was showing great service.
author: Alex Q.

description:
Customer service here is top notch - no customer should ever feel like they're not getting the most out of their experience coming here. The first time I came here the store was empty and my friend and I got to try a sample of one of their drinks. Then after we ordered and our drinks were made we got to try it and adjust it however we liked to make sure we were leaving the store with our drinks at the most perfect and enjoyable state. Keep up the great work! 

My second time coming it was busier and it was more of a come and go situation. I'm always a reasonable person and don't really like to be the one to go back and ask to readjust a drink, so I ended up leaving not as satisfied about my drink compared to my first experience, but they emphasize that they will always change it for you so my advice to everyone coming here is to take advantage of that and don't leave with a bad review!
author: Alyssa G.

description: Just ordered 3 drinks. I normally test my drinks before leaving but I was in a hurry. Mine tasted as if the tea bag used to make my drink was at the end of its lifespan. A bit bitter and watered down. Hope the rest of the drinks aren't the same.
author: James L.

description: Quality Premium Tea Bar!  Boba pearls are the perfect consistency-not hard, not too soft either; everyone is nice, friendly & professional.  Thanks Steap Tea Bar!
author: Ann E.

description: Had the taro milk tea and it's the best one I've tried ever! Thai milk tea was less satisfying though.
author: Nurul S.

description: Best tea place I've tried! A lot of boba/tea places serve drink that have an artificial taste to it, whereas their teas have a delicious authentic tea taste to it. They have the coolest drinks too!
author: Esther B.

description:
Would give 6 if possible!

 The options are pretty awesome there and the customer service is out of this world. I have never been to a shop, especially a Boba shop, that pays so much attention and helps you with deciding. I'm super indecisive so I stood there for a while and Erika, the wonderful lady behind the counter, offered to let me try whatever I wanted. My boyfriend and I tried 3 drinks total and she made each one from scratch so we could try it :o that was amazing. We ended up getting the matcha latte and purple rain. 

Purple rain is awesome!! It's a lemonade that is super fresh, they make it right there in front of you and it has butterfly peaflower tea which gives it a beautiful purple color. It was so refreshing and something I would come back for. The matcha was alright, it wasn't the best but passable. We tried the black milk tea and that was pretty yummy!

Overall, great selections, they muddle ingredients and even use a shaker as if it's a cocktail. The space is small in terms of workspace but it's still a good place to get work done and strong wifi. Erika remembered our names even after 1.5 hrs of us working quietly. You're the best Erika!!
author: Larissa L.

description: The tea was good, staff was friendly, boba was chewy. No complaints. The girl was super nice and let us sample the different boba and even made a drink so one of the girls could sample it before she bought it.
author: Donna H.

description:
LOVE Steap Tea Bar!!! I feel like I just stepped into the W Hotel. The furniture is modern, music is great, the drink bar is sleek, they have a fun antler chandelier, and their staff are so fun! Plus they have a good amount of seating which I'm always a fan of.

I ordered the roasted milk tea and it was divine. Hope they can extend their hours and become the after-hours go-to of boba. Looking forward to coming back! Thanks for a great experience!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Hands down, my favorite boba. While I love many of the places around the city, Steap puts everything together in the best way.

I highly recommend the Black Milk, but substitute boba for grass jelly. If you want it more like other boba spots, ask for a little extra sweetness. But I actually prefer the tea as it comes; the balls provide plenty more sweetness to add. 

The other reason I prefer Steap is the customization. The servers can use any combination of their ingredients, so it is easy to satisfy my pickier tea friends.
author: Derek L.

description:
Steap is the tea bar I've been looking for in SF. I've missed the Taiwanese cafés near LA, because those are the best outside Taiwan. Boba Guys ain't it.

Steap's standard concoctions are already good, but if you have preferences, they make adjustments so you never have to settle. Today, we went and I had them customize for me: roasted milk tea, less sweet with 5 ccs each of non-dairy creamer and almond milk. That way, the even roasted milk tea flavors really come through. 

When you go, taste the tea before they seal it and have them make it perfect for you too!
author: Coleen C.

description: Got invited here for an event and we tried many different flavours of tea. My favourites were the kumquat green, Pink Kitty, and almond milk pearl. The owner, Emil, is super friendly and knowledgeable about tea. He makes a fresh batch of boba every 3 hours!
author: Michelle C.

description: Not sure how this place got 4 star rating. Ordered a mill tea with boba. The drink itself has no tea flavor at all. Taste like sugar water. Good boba though.
author: Jerome J.

description: Owner and staff are amazing! Place super nice and so clean. Never been to a boba place that is so modern and sleek. They have different drinks to choose from not just your ordinary milk tea they use organic ingredients. The tea is great. The place is beautiful simple but elegant. And staff are absolutely amazing and friendly!
author: Michele T.

description:
A bit disappointed with the tea.  I got the roasted rice milk drink with boba. It was around $4.00.  I think the tea could of been stronger.  The boba was just perfectly sweet. I got to sample a taste of my drink after it was prepared.  

Plenty of barstools and wifi/outlets.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Overpriced tea that tastes mediocre.

The owner thinks he knows your taste preference better than you. Not only that, he talks about how his shop is better than others because his workers don't make the tea behind walls. Have you been to Asha? T4? iTea? No? Then sit down. Be humble. 

Trying to bad mouth your competitors (who have been around way longer than you have btw) is a terrible way to start to your business. And it leaves a bad taste in your mouth; yes, one that's worse than the one left by the tea you thought your customers would enjoy.
author: Gorlan Y.

description: This is my go to place for milk tea in the Bay Area. Even though I'm one of the very few who order their strawberry milk tea  (which by the way I don't understand because it's bomb!)- I'm happy that they don't get rid of that flavor :) love their loyalty program and their staff is super friendly!
author: Lauren A.

description:
Steap Tea Bar is a super hipster little shop in Chinatown! They have options that normal boba places don't usually offer. The teas vary from green tea to jade to hibiscus. The toppings vary from activated charcoal to chia seeds to boba. The milks also vary from almond milk to dairy milk to organic milk. 

There are so many choices and combinations, and that's what makes this little tea shop so exciting. I was able to try the kumquat green tea with activated charcoal and boba, with the help of the barista. She was right about activated charcoal making you feel better about yourself after drinking it. Something to note is that activated charcoal does make the drink a little chalky, though it doesn't add any extra flavor. It's just apparently something healthier and nutritious to add into the drink. 

Also, with an easy check in on yelp I was able to get $1 off my drink, so $6 went to $5. Still expensive but I think the natural ingredients in this drink concoction is pretty darn great. So don't forget to check in before you purchase a drink!!
author: Wendy T.

description: What's the difference between a trash can and Steap Tea Bar ?? Nothing. This place is in a need of desperate help. I ordered 4 milk tea all of them tasted very bland and the only decent thing on the menu was their lemonade. Guys find some place else if your looking for boba.
author: Marcus V.

description: Walking through Chinatown and looked up on yelp for nearest boba. OMG! Did this hit the spot!! The regular black milk tea with boba my hubby got was one of the best I've ever had but my favorite was the chia tea latte!!! Wish they had other locations!!!
author: Paula M.

description: Fantastic service - above & beyond.  Very clean with good options.  I got a milk tea with lychee jelly and my kids got taro with boba.
author: Carrie N.

description:
Emil, the owner, is very passionate about his tea. The baristas are as well. If you don't like your drink, they will make it right. Conveniently next to the YMCA Chinatown and across the street from the MUNI 1 heading towards the Richmond and Willy Wong Woo Playground, this is a great place to relax and grab a refreshment. The boba, I was told, is the same boba source that Boba Guys use. I will be back!

Pro:
+Great ingredients. Use quality organic milk, almond milk, and soy milk. Great matcha.
+Kill some time with their photo machine. Tag yourself to the Steap Tea Bar on Instagram while you are there and a photo will print out. It's fun!
+Solid boba and I've had a lot of boba.
+Solid grass jelly.
+Takes credit card.
+Free wifi.
+Great location for public transit users.
+Boba Guys is nearby and across the tunnel. This place is just as good without the line.
+Friendly folks that care about their tea and accept feedback.
+Gender neutral restrooms.

Con:
-Limited and not the most comfortable seating space. It's more of a grab and go place. Hard to hang out here for too long.
-I hope they make almond jello sometime. Love that stuff.
-A drink here will easily run you $5-$6 bucks for the large and $4-$5 for a medium/regular. Elsewhere in the neighborhood, you can expect to pay $1-2 less. It's not just steap tea, it's steep prices!
author: Tina C.

description: Some of the best tea I've had! Not to mention the store is cute and very clean. Will definitely come here again when I'm in the area.
author: Jaqs C.

description:
I recently visited Steap with my family. We arrived 20 minutes prior to closing and noticed someone mopping the floor and the chairs packed up. We peeked in thinking that we will have to return another day, but the friendly staff welcomed us in! Of one the women introduced the menu to us, sharing her highly recommended drinks and alternatives. 

We ordered the Almond Milk Pearl, Mango Paradise, Jasmine Milk Tea, and Kumquat Green. Every drink was a hit! The refreshing and clean taste of the drinks reflect the fresh ingredients used. The price for a medium (16 oz) was only about $0.50 more than other boba places in the city, but this compensates for the fresh ingredients used. Better yet, you know every ingredient that goes into your drink because it is listed on the menu. Steap prides itself on using the highest quality ingredients and less sugar. These are a plus, as many boba places use powder instead of fresh ingredients and are way too sweet. 

I truly appreciate how considerate the staff are in regards to satisfying our needs. Before serving us the drink, they poured out a sample in a small paper cup and asked if we liked the taste or if we would like to adjust the sweetness. One of the staff even remade one of our drinks because she was not satisfied with the end result! We also later learned that the man behind the counter was the owner, Emil. He seems very passionate about his craft and ensured that my family and I had a great experience. We will surely return to fulfill our boba cravings. The best part in discovering Steap? We can now enjoy boba feeling (slightly) less guilty!
author: Alyson S.

description: This is definitely my favorite place to get tea!! Not only is the tea refreshing, but the boba is by far the best in San Francisco. They source their ingredients from Taiwan, arriving fresh and ready to mix in to a number of different tea options. My favorite is the almond milk pearl, but there are so many to choose from. I'll try to step outside the box next time and try the purple rain... love the color .
author: Ben W.

description: We had the most pleasant experience here! We had never been here before and Erica was so helpful to us. She gave us recommendations and was very patient in explaining a lot of the items on the menu to us. Before she sealed our drinks and gave them to us, she gave us a small sample of each of them to try for us to make sure the sweetness level was okay. The place had great music and we sat and talked/charged our phones for about 30 minutes. We would highly recommend this place! OH, and our teas were amazing.
author: Jessie A.

description: I haven't had amazing boba in quite a while and thanks to Steap in SF, I'm missing boba! I was visiting Chinatown/SF from LA on a weekender and was thirsty for an afternoon drink with my travel buddy. Stumbled upon Step and the Green Queen was my order. WOW!! Very impressive drink, AND there were actual mint leaves lol. All drinks were made to order, and QUICK at that!
author: Bin H.

description:
Ordered via Postmates.

Postmates' interface is bad and it was a bit confusing to order (wanted boba but couldn't actually add it, so I mentioned it in the merchant notes).

Steap totally stepped up, included the boba, and made sure I had a great experience.

You guys are awesome and are now on my list of boba places to actually go to instead of just ordering from.
author: Josh W.

description: Good alternative for Boba Guy.  Same quality, about same price, but much less crowd.  Its regular sweetness is 50 percent instead of 100 percent.  My favorites are Kumquat Green Tea, Moroccan Mint, and Thai Tea.  Favorite toppings are aloe Vera, grass jelly, and of course boba.
author: Charles S.

description: Even though the prices were a little on the high end for boba, the quality was excellent, the drinks were unique, and the sweet girl working kept on treating us to samples. I'd say it was one of the best boba experiences in terms of service, and a very pleasant surprise in terms of taste. 5 stars for quality, 4 stars for price (which really isn't bad if you only get boba less than twice a month like me).
author: Kristen C.

description: Not bad but not great. I was expecting more flavor but that's what I get for ordering 25% sugar.
author: J L.

description: I have to say Steap Tea Bar had great service. The employees were very friendly and gave a nice "hello" and "thank you" when I came in and out of the store. However, the drink was overpriced and tasted bland. I ordered the Matcha Latte and it literally tasted like matcha powder and water. The boba balls were all stuck together and made it difficult to drink out of the straw. In this picture, you can see multiple boba balls stuck in the straw, making it impossible for me to drink this matcha powder and water mixture. This drink was $5.50 ($5.50 too much). If you're looking for friendly workers but awful drinks, Steap is the place to go.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Very interesting business, love the owner who is clearly passionate about boba. I guess their business model is well crafted ,drink by drink boba. The thing is with this boba market in SF, the price is way high in comparison to other places. 

Best boba in china town imo, their boba is pretty good and soft.

The small costs $5 for some, which maybe is just inflation starting to set in but still, I can think of many other cheaper boba places . Maybe not an issue for people who work in the FIDI but still, the price is just drastically high for boba.

If I'm in the area, I'll be back.
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
Get ready for these guys to take over the Tea Bar business around DT/Chinatown location. I have nothing but positive things to say about this local business.

Drink I've tried: A flavorful, satisfying rich cup of Matcha Latte (Served cold but this one as well as their other drinks could also be served hot.)

Samples I've tried: Kumquat (tangy, sweet but not overpowering, subtle lemony flavor) / Honey Love (tea w/ a fruity cocktail mix, similar to something you'd get at a bar, but no alcohol.)

Quality of drink / service:
Beyond my expectations! 

They brand themselves to provide an environment with a influence mix of a bar/ boba tea vibe. Not only that, they proudly talk about the utmost quality in the various teas and ingredients they offer, coming from Thailand, Sri Lanka, Japan, and Taiwan. 

About the owners: These guys have an incredible, friendly outgoing personality, with a wide range of background experience working in server and barista roles. They gave an exceptional quality of service that is competitive  to one of the top coffee places, Philz, but even more personal and better. They offered me to try out their drink samples, and a proportionate amount of their homemade, delicious sample of Taiwanese Styled Grass Jelly (which is close to authentic!). Before leaving the store, they made sure that I am completely satisfied with my drink! 

Cons/Minor Improvements: I hope that there will be more toppings, types of drinks (smoothies, tea mixes, cocktail dessert frappes), snack foods, desserts, and maybe even a small area for gaming entertainment for both older adults and younger people like me. I'm thinking of a Dave & Busters type of vibe for this place. ;) 

Overall, based on my experience here, I'd definitely bring in a few friends to come check this place out regularly.
author: Angela L.

description: The service is nice and the drinks were good. They let you taste it and make sure that you like it before you're sent on your way. Very good service. Would definitely go back
author: Stephy H.

description:
I came to Steap on my break from work because I saw pictures of the drinks on Yelp and on my friends' snapchats/instagrams. 

I ordered a medium Mango Paradise (which is basically a small for most boba chains tbh not trying to throw shade tho) with boba, which was $4.50. 
The tea was pretty good; it wasn't sour or overly artificial like some mango flavored drinks I've had before, but there wasn't much mango taste to it. It could've been because of the lime slices included into the drink, but it just wasn't mango-y enough for me. 
The boba was meh for me. It was *the* perfect texture, but there was no taste to it, which is a bummer. 
The drink in general was above average, but not as good as other places I've been to. 

On the plus side though, the customer service here is freakin great. The girl who took my order and made my drink had to have been the nicest bobarista I've ever encountered. She even asked me if the amount of boba she put in my cup was enough and if she should add more, which boba places rarely do. 

*PROS*
-boba texture is gr8
-workers are the nicest people ever
-drinks here are pretty unique
-has wifi/seating/outlets
-very aesthetic (perfect for insta/tumblr/etc.)

*CONS*
-kinda pricy for the size
-(my) boba had no flavor
author: Cynthia Y.

description:
The place is pretty small, but it's a cute little place. It was hard to find the place, since they had only a small stand with their name on it. Parking was definitely difficult to find, so we just parked in the parking lot. $5 for an hour on weekends. Once we found the place, the employees were really friendly and professional, as they want to get the best drink to your taste. I ordered the Kumquat Green with Hibicus topper and Aloe Vera, but it was really bitter to me, I didn't like it at all. But the colors were really pretty, so I got fooled by that. The iced chai were really good though, so I would definitely come back for that. 

Recommendation(s):
Iced Chai

Visit Again: Yes
Recommendation to Others: Yes
author: Annie Y.

description:
Great milk tea and great service.
Their roasted milk tea is my personal favorite. Although it costs more than other places, I still come for their high quality drinks.
author: Henry T.

description:
I walk by this place plenty of times during its construction phase. I walked by today and they're opened for business! 

First and foremost, the staff that operate and manage this place is top notch. Friendly, helpful and positive attitude. I couldn't ask for any better service.

Something that blew my mind...I haven't had this good of a boba topping since Hong Kong. It's such a great consistency(not firm and not mushy) and not overwhelming sweet like other places, just brought me back when I had to travel non-stop for work and boba is the only thing I look forward to when I landed at the airport.

I took some of its menu/flyers back to the office...which of course attracted much attention of my fellow co-workers. I have no more menu/flyers on my desk, the girls took it all and should be heading to this place any moment now...
author: Mike Z.

description: The price is a little expensive, it's around $5 and the size is a little smaller than most stores but the use everything organic. The customer service is amazing. Emil (I think that's his name) is super amazing, and he tries to make the perfect drink. He poured out a little bit of the drink for himself to test out and when it wasn't the right sweetness, he remade the drink. He says that taste and quality of the drinks is really important to them. And it's  customer satisfaction, if you don't like your drink..... he will remake it. Overall, a great store but just a little pricey. But the quality is worth it.
author: Angela C.

description: Best almond milk matcha I've had! Great boba and super nice service. Definitely try it!
author: Makayla W.

description: Aaah so glad this opened up right behind my house-- now I don't have to wait in boba guys line anymore! Their matcha latte with pearls is on point
author: Charmie W.
Rana K.

description:
Serendipitously stumbled upon this place on the weekend of Chinese NY, very happy that we did! 

Just one visit convinced me that it's my favorite boba place in Chinatown. The menu leaves you only with good options, the service was quite generous and thoughtful, and the boba itself was the best I've had outside of Taiwan! 

High marks all around - I would definitely recommend this place to my co-workers and friends!
author: Christian P.

description: My friend and I stumbled in to this store serendipitously on the way to another tea shop in Chinatown. We are so so happy that we chose Steap instead!! Not only was the almond milk boba tea delicious, but the people in the shop were some of the kindest baristas I've ever encountered (and I'm originally from the South, where we're known for our hospitality). My friend also enjoyed his fruitier mango tea, and we thought that all the drinks on the menu were very inventive. The green tea was very high quality, as was the boba in it. We got to try a fresh batch of their boba, and it was prepared perfectly!! Definitely recommend stopping in here the next time you are in the Chinatown area.
author: Maria T.

description: This is by far my favorite tea shop ever, the tea is perfect and not like most places that are overly sweet. Emil the owner is one of the friendliest and most charismatic people I know, this place if full of bubbling energy I will definitely be coming back soon!
author: Jesse P.

description:
First time trying this place -- found it on Yelp!

They don't have a super large selection of drinks. You can either choose from their 10 different Signature Drinks or you can Build Your Own. But I actually really like that! Whenever boba places have a HUGE selection, I just get sus about the quality of the drink. Like Quickly's. 

I tried the Matcha Latte & it was pretty good! It was a LITTLE bit powdery, but nothing crazy. You can really taste the matcha. Not like, Starbuck's matcha. Perfect amount of sweetness and bitterness. Like everyone here mentioned -- the service was really good and chill! They're super nice & friendly and genuinely wants to create well-made drinks for their customers. 

P.S. to Steap - I hope you are getting a big STEAP sign outside soon because I almost couldn't find you guys!!
author: Christina X.

description: Fantastic tea selection, flavor, and great staff. If you aren't feeling something on the menu, they will walk through some custom teas they can create for you. True 'tea barista' experience.
author: Allen L.

description: Easily my favorite boba place in SF. The staff at Steap are very friendly and accommodating and they have some great flavors. It's awesome that they'll even make drinks for you to taste before you order and go the distance to make sure you're happy with your drink.
author: Josh B.

description: I first found out this place when my roommate mentioned it to me. I had disparaged of ever finding a good boba shop near downtown. I mean, there are good boba shops in the Richmond and Sunset districts but not much in downtown. At least compared to DTLA, which I was used to. I have come a few times and in the words of R - This place is pretty hip. There's loud top-40's hits, sleek decor, and even free wifi. Despite it having free wifi, there isn't really any tables for you to sit comfortably with a computer. There's a bar with swivel stools but it's also where people line up to order, so it's a bit uncomfortable. I like their teas, although it's on the expensive side but then again, it's practically Boba guys' pricing. I usually get the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba. No need to get less sugar. There really isn't the need for adjustment since it's a low level of sugar. Besides the traditional tea bar options, they have healthy styled drinks, sort of detox and smoothies. Options for people interested in milk tea and not. Would come again whenever I am in the area and craving a milk tea.
author: Michelle R.

description: There is no comparison to this place and Quickly! There matcha is the bomb. It's a whole different class of bubble tea than those that serves sugar water.
author: May G.

description: Just came to check out Steap Tea Bar, what a fabulous place!!! I ordered the matcha latte, OMG delicious.  The lovely gents who made my delicious drink were super nice and friendly.  You could tell the quality of tea is exceptional.  I will definitely be coming back for the delicious teas, great ambiance, and friendly service.
author: Ti T.

description: This place was great! Awesome my daughter didn't like the drink she order and the gentleman was very understanding and he made her a brand new drink of her choice. They environment was great it was very clean it was very hip and up-to-date
author: Karina R.

description: I love boba. I get boba every chance i have. Their menu looks different and many teas that others doesn't have. I wished i can give them more stars but my almond milk tea and my husband's milk tea was very very bland. I am used to nuttier almond milks and their almond milk didn't taste like anything. Sweetness was perfect but the flavor of the tea was just not there. Maybe i will try the other teas if i am in the area.
author: Sophie L.

description: A Chinatown oasis with the best tea drinks I've ever had! Quick, yet perfectly crafted. I love the mango passion iced greet tea signature drink with boba. Right next to the YMCA, it's an awesome pre- or post-workout drink. Quick walk from 555 California Street for a mid-afternoon break too. Wish I could give it 6 stars.
author: Rory C.

description: Wonderful food, nice people, great bubble tea. Large menu too, definitely worth a try. Our favorite cafes.
author: Elena C.

description: I had the kumquat one with pearls. Slightly bitter. I got it with low sweetness. It was quite refreshing on a hot day but not sure if the bitterness was supposed to be there.
author: Ke D.

description: Wow this place is amazing. The workers here have 10/10 service and completely accommodating of your orders. My first time here, the cashier (maybe the boss) gave us samples of their popular drinks and offered different levels of sweetness. I ordered the Mango Tea with boba and it was perfect - overall recommend coming here to try it out.
author: Jan Z.

description:
Introduced this tea bar to my compadres and they were impressed with quality of
The drinks. They're definitely coming back for more!
author: Patricia L.

description: I loved their tea! I am more of a fruity tea kind of person so I tried the hibiscus tea and it was so good!! Best tea I've had.
author: Victoria B.

description:
A true Mixologist. These guys take extreme pride in everything they make and are true experts of the craft-- every one of their drinks and ingredients is handcrafted and made with precision. Ive been to nearly every Boba and tea spot in SF, and when it comes to quality and taste-- STEAP stands out by far. 

There unique signature drinks are also a must! Highly recommended!
author: Anthony G.

description: This is high-quality boba at its best! Definitely superior product and the young lady at the register could not have been nicer. She is professional and courteous with a genuine smile that makes you want to return for more. You can tell that their motto is the customer is always right. Can't wait to go back and try all the flavors.
author: Bethany P.

description: I got my tea quickly and it was very good. There wasn't too much sugar and the lychee and aloe tasted really fresh. There were only two guys working at the time and about 6 customers inside, they managed to get us all served quickly.
author: Alexis O.

description: What a fantastic place! They customized a drink for me -- rooibos, almond milk and boba -- that was out of this world! THEN, upon seeing my obsession with retrieving the very last boba from the bottom of the cup, the dear sweet wonderful tea-rista have me a sample cup of boba!! I almost asked her to marry me.
author: Misha A.

description: The worker was really sweet and they have a unique  menu with lots to offer! Their drinks are top quality with good ingredients! Love the concept and the menu!
author: Annalyssa B.

description: I was here during Thanksgiving.  My philosophy is that For a tea place, I will not give more than 3 stars if real taro is not used.  I ordered a warm taro drink so it is hard to tell how well the pearls would have fared with a cold drink.
author: Kim N.

description:
Update: The owner did refund our drinks after seeing this review, so I'm adding a star. Unfortunately my friends and I were just not that impressed with the milk tea itself. Boba was on the hard side and we prefer chewy. Milk Tea was on the milk side and we prefer a stronger tea. Probably won't return since it wasn't our cup of tea but the staff and ambiance is great. We might be picky because we are from the south bay where there are so many really great authentic Taiwanese places that this pales in comparison.


Previous Review:
Staff was super friendly but milk tea was more milk than tea. Cashier asked us to check in to Yelp for $1 off but then did not give us the $1 off. :( Don't know why my drink was $4.89 (with the supposed $1 off) but my friend's was $4.50 (she didn't check in). My friend and I who checked in got taxed and didn't get the discount... very disappointing.
author: Catherine E.

description: Good atmosphere and the employees are really nice!
author: Kevin W.

description: Great service! Fresh boba made every 3 hours. I got the taro milk tea with almond milk and it was heavenly. One of the best I've ever had.
author: Sarah Z.

description: I really wanted to like this place. The interior is nice and clean and the menu looks really promising. I ordered my usual, Jasmine Milk Tea with boba, less sweet (and no tea jelly since it was listed on the  menu). It would help if they added the sweetness by percentage, but back to my order - it tasted like sweetened milk with boba, which wasn't bad but I really wanted a milk tea, you know, with tea. I didn't even taste a hint of tea. I took just a sip as I walked out so I was already in the car and leaving when I realized there was no tea flavor so, so much for having my drink re-made and enough of a turn off to not return.
author: Cheryl H.

description: Modern boba shop near the main Chinatown drag, my match latte was perfect, loved that the barista checked on sweetness level and the drink was just perfect for me (think philz service). If you want a higher quality milk tea right in Chinatown, come here!
author: starrynight c.

description: Just had the Jasmine milk tea and the almond milk tea. The boba pearls are really good compared to some places in So-Cal, but for the mill tea it was just not to par. I don't know if it was just this time or I didn't get the right drink but it just tasted flavorless. Overall the workers are really nice and the place looks nice, but just not like the boba tea in So-Cal.
author: Anthony L.

description: Ordered the Just Peachy. They should just rename it to Lemon Tea because the lemon was overpowering the drink. Other than that, the bobas not bad and the interior is aesthetically pleasing.
author: Kin L.

description:
My Order: I ordered a lychee black milk tea, with almond milk and more sugar. 

Service: The customer service here was fantastic, I had the pleasure of meeting the owner, Emil, and another worker, whose name I forgot. The worker was very helpful with my order and answered my questions. It was my first time at Steap and I was wondering what would taste good with my "build your own" milk tea. While I waited for my milk tea, I had a very nice conversation with Emil about the quality of teas and ingredients that he uses. At first, I was hesitant on trying out this place because I felt that the prices were a little high compared to neighboring milk tea places, but I guess Steap does use higher quality ingredients, so the price increase makes sense.

I love milk tea, and I usually settle for the cheaper alternatives in Chinatown or across the city. And yes, too much milk tea is bad, so spending the extra money on QUALITY ingredients once in a while is probably better for my health.

Overall, I would recommend trying this place out. The service was fantastic, and Emil really wants you to enjoy your drink and your experience at Steap.
author: Michelle T.

description:
I was initially intrigued by the aesthetic of the establishment and wanted to give it a try. My biggest complaint is how pretentious and snooty everything feels here. There's all this stuff on the menu boasting about quality ingredients. Ugh, I should probably have kept my expectations in check. Their boba pearls are very inconsistent and overall not soft enough. As for the tea, one sip of my drink and I knew it was a mistake to come here. This stuff tastes like medicine. Save your money and venture somewhere else in the plethora of boba places in downtown.

Oh yeah, and for Chinatown, prices here are a little on the STEEAP side, no pun intended. And personally I think, Quickly boba tastes better than here.
author: Julia Q.

description: Super good boba. Decided to come by after hearing all the good things about this place. Had the Mango Paradise and it was perfect. Not too sweet, with just the right flavoring. The mango juice and lime made it so smooth.
author: arthur t.

description: Steap tea bar is a really great looking place and has a very awesome atmosphere. The music they play is awesome and the costumer service was really great.
author: Zac D.

description:
Unique selections with creative names like the dirty kitty and purple butterfly. The tea is on the expensive end, but quality is good. Tea is mixed in front of you and customizable to your liking. 

The owner and staff are very nice. If you ever can't decide what to get, he is really helpful in suggesting tea/topping combinations. The staff and the all gender bathroom sign definitely makes me feel welcomed.
author: Rachel C.

description: I am SO happy to have found this place! Milk teas with healthy, local, fresh ingredients?!?! Yes!!! Califia almond milk is awesome to put into milk tea. Staff and owner were great too. I can't wait to get over there again!
author: Angie B.

description: Out of the couple of boba places I have gone to this is defiantly the best. The workers there are friendly and actually care about the customer. I went in and asked for the mango tea with boba and without me asking, the woman asked if I had ever had lychee and let me taste some. I liked it and was able to get the perfect drink because of her. The first time I came here was my first ever time trying boba and the man was friendly and let my try some before getting my drink and helped me choose what to get. Overall, the staff is friendly and always serve the best drinks. (The mango tea with a mix of boba and lychee is perfect). Defiantly stop by if your in china town.
author: JP B.

description: Want the best Bubble Tea with no lines and smiling faces behind the counter. I have had Bubble Tea from all over the city, but this is by far the best. The staff has always been welcoming. The tea itself just taste better. Then why is there no line?! you ask. Just because it's so new and undiscovered. Get it while you can!! I recommend go with the classic Almond Milk Tea. Don't worry, there are plenty of options if you want to change it up.
author: Justin C.

description: The drink  is gracefully good nice texture really good boba. The milk always on target the boss is super duper cool.  The store really need more more people come try there milk tea.
author: Jay W.

description: It always bothers me when drink places don't fill up the cup all the way. this place does that, otherwise it would be 5 stars, but the drink and service are both pretty good. I generally don't like how sweet most places are and this strikes a nice balance.
author: Kevin L.

description: wow, amazed by this boba place!! the interior is very elegant and has calm music, the cashier is really nice even though im indecisive. but eventually she got annoyed but the person i was with. but i ordered jasmine green milk tea with no ice, they gave me jasmine green tea instead and kinda got annoyed when i told them i was almond milk. but i guess overall the service was okay. the drink was only okay, the taste was 3/5 but I liked how the lychee jelly didn't cover the taste of the tea, unlike other boba places where no matter what drink I get, the lychee jelly covers the taste of the tea.
author: Nathalie M.

description: My coworker and I have now made this our go to afternoon boba spot. The owner and his partner are both very knowledgeable. They explained the science behind how they prepare their boba and the way they are looking to differentiate themselves in an already saturated SF boba market by producing high quality and fresh teas. The lemon and lime wedge is a nice touch.
author: Erik D.

description: Lots of options and the vibe is cool. The atmosphere is sleek and welcoming. Tenders are friendly and I felt at home upon entering. I will definitely return and use the dollar off check in. LOL
author: Isaac S.

description: I love going to Steap! I love my boba drink (Taro Milk) and some of the other drinks offered (like Purple Rain). I want to keep trying new drinks but I love and now started to crave my Taro Milk, so it is going to be hard to branch out. Everything in Steap Tea Bar looks new, shiny and modern. They keep it very clean, which is always a great sign. The staff is friendly and accommodating. There is a sign that says something like, if you are not happy with your drink, please let them know. I discussed this sign with the owner. He truly wants every customer completely happy with their drink. I love this attitude (he was sincere, chill and really nice). That said, after reading a few of these Yelp reviews, where anyone was not completely satisfied with their drink, why would they not have gotten the drink adjusted so they were happy?
