Seems odd to me.
author: Nicole M.

description: I love Steap!  I don't understand how this place is not always packed.  I think I have tried almost every boba place in San Francisco and this is hands down the best one.  The mixologists always want to make the customers happy and are willing to re-make any drink that you do not love.  They have all types of milk options and can adjust the sweetness level just to your liking.
author: Emily T.

description: Their drink was always the best because they drink test the drink before they send it out as ready to take from the pickup. Seating are great. Free wifi. Free to charge your phone.
author: Victor C.

description: First time coming to this place after hearing only good reviews! Located conveniently next to the YMCA at which I seasonally work. The staff were very nice and friendly and even offered to make drinks for me so I could sample the different flavors. The jasmine and roasted milk were pretty conventional and the flavors were as expected. I ended up going with the almond milk pearl, which I felt was a bit bland, and the boba was soft. My friends really enjoyed it the time they got it though, so maybe I'll try it again to see if I get a better blend. Good experience overall!
author: Helen J.

description: Service is always on point. My go-tos are the Roasted Milk and Jasmine Milk. Both come with tea jelly (grass jelly). I always get my drinks more sweet and I'm always given a sample of my drink before they pour it into the cup and seal it. This is a must try, as it is the best boba tea place in Chinatown.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Great service! Great drinks! Interesting flavor combos, a must hit if you're in Chinatown!
author: Dustin F.

description: I got the Roasted Milk Today with no toppings & less sweet. It's really good, perfect !
author: Francis C.

description: Update - I took them to on their offer to try the drinks again. The employee working there today was really courteous and focused on making sure we liked our drinks. My colleague said it was a VIP experience! The boba was much better this time, assume last time was a fluke. Will patronize again!
author: Yan K.

description: The matcha latte had a strong, flavorful matcha taste. Less sweet (25%) was barely sweet at all, but along with boba and the cream top, it was perfect. The cream top (their version of crema) is probably my favorite crema I've had (compared to Gong Cha, Sharetea, Happy Lemon and STEEP). It's lightly sweet, not too salty, and has more of a cream flavor than other places. I ordered the smaller size, but they made my drink in a larger cup to better accommodate my crema! Awesome. Not particularly cheap, but that's boba these days.
author: Linda N.

description: Amazing quality, great service, cool atmos. They put a lot of attention and effort into everything that they do, but without the lines and attitude of the more popular places. Start heading to this spot before it becomes one of those. Love this place!
author: Preston B.

description: My new favorite tea bar in the Chinatown area!  The staff are super friendly. Boba and tea jelly are made in house. Best of all they use my favorite almond milk - Califia! Highly recommend and will be coming here often!
author: Dana K.

description: Beautiful ambiance, friendly service and, most important, the best tea I've ever had! The boba is made fresh every day, and the options are all customizable - I don't like sugar and was able to get my drink sugar free. Highly recommend checking this place out!
author: anna k.

description: The boba is good. Closest to Wonderful's boba out of the many that I've tried.. The Roast Milk was great.
author: Aaron H.

description:
Much better than your typical bubble tea place. The teas are very flavorful and not overly sweet, or heavy.  Simply, they are very refreshing. 

Watch out, this location is a little hard to find as there is only plain black awning out front, and a small sandwich board sign on the street.
author: Jon F.

description:
I've only been here once so far, but I have to say the service alone garners a five star rating. I went in a week ago and ordered a regular size "custom drink", which was a black tea base, regular sweetness, strawberry flavor, with a mixture of almond and skim milk, and boba. I know, not terribly adventurous, but I felt "basic" that day. I almost didn't get the strawberry. Anyway, I get my drink some moments later. The gentleman told me to let him know if my drink needed to be modified. I walk back to my seat, tried my drink and didn't think it was sweet enough. I really hate feeling like I'm bothering someone, but he did ask and the drink was quite pricey for it to just be ok. I told him that I liked it a bit sweeter, to which he graciously replied that he'd make me a new drink in a couple minutes. By that point, a number of customers have trickled in, so he was busy making their drinks. Surprisingly, he let me keep my old drink, which I just gave to my sister. After he mixed my new drink, he checked to see if it was to my liking, before sealing it. How thoughtful! A moment later, I was presented with a new, now large, drink! Honestly, the best service I've recieved at a boba shop... and I've been to several. I'm a bit of a milk tea connoisseur. The gentleman then left for the day. I appreciate that, even though he was on his way out, he still took the time and care to ensure that I liked my drink. And as we were leaving, the other gentleman apologized for "messing up" my drink. They are just too nice here! No one messed up anything, I just have a sweet tooth. 

Apart from the fantastic service, the tea here is good! My sister and I both enjoyed our drinks. She got the iced matcha. I tried it and it's definitely real matcha. It has a bitterness and is a bit earthy, so if you want more of a dessert taste, get extra sugar. My (new) drink was nicely balanced and perfectly sweetened. They do have some unique and interesting creations here, so maybe I'll be more adventurous next time!
author: Vanessa U.

description: I was addicted to boba tea for a few years, but stopped drinking it because many places use too much sugar and even when you can order it unsweetened the non-diary milk options were not good, like maybe a non-diary powder creamer or soy. So then I would order no milk, no sugar and just tea with grass jelly or boba, but after getting rid of sugar and milk you really taste the tea and most places had crappy tea. Really glad I walked past Steap Tea and that the ingredients here are really good. I especially love the homemade grass jelly! Also, love the hibiscus tea and all the green milk teas which are awesome with almond milk, hot or cold. Absolutely my favorite tea place in SF! And I've probably tried 75% in the SF Bay Area.
author: jean e.

description:
I went to Steap tea bar today. The services was really good also the people were good.They were very friendly to us both.When we tried it out with the mango tea with lychee and a milk tea and tapioca on it. When we took the first sip of the those drink's then our mind exploded. Finnaly it was a very awesome experince to have those kind of drinks with my son(It was great).P.S you guys made us very very happy.

                          YOU GUYS ARE AWESOME!!!!!!!!!
author: Noriko D.

description:
tl;dr: expensive but drinks made with quality ingredients. bland milk tea but cute photo station.

In all honesty, I came here on Saturday with my friends because the Boba Guys line was waaay too long and this boba joint seemed to have very high reviews. At the time, I was contemplating either ordering Roasted Milk Tea or Jasmine Milk tea, but I ultimately decided on Roasted Milk Tea because I decided that JMT could be found practically anywhere. Their cashier who took my order was really nice and friendly and the music (Drake) made for a really chill and hip environment. Unfortunately, when my drink came out, I found that my milk tea was pretty bland-- with only a hint of roasted tea taste-- and their organic sugar reminded me of Stevia or some kind of fake sugar. In short, it tasted like water to both my friends (who tried my drink) and me. 
I even tried my friend's Jasmine Milk Tea which also tasted like water... I saw that they had a sign in which they stated that they would be willing to fix your drinks if you didn't like it, but the only other drink I wanted was Jasmine Milk Tea so I refrained from changing my drink. 

On the bright side, the boba was delicious and I love how the photo booth would instantly print any picture you wanted on Instagram.

If I were to come back, I'd probably try their non-milk drinks because those seem to have better reviews...
author: Winnie L.

description: I will give them 5 stars because they were really really great with customers service. There is a small board in the store saying if you don't like your boba we'll make it again for you. They really stick by that sign. I'm used to my boba sweet and not too milky tasting. So when they made my boba the first time I wasn't happy with it,  so they made a new one for me. I was really surprised with their service. The second time they made it just the way I like it. The restaurant looks really clean and nice. It is a little overpriced. But since they were so committed to customer service, I was okay to pay a little high price.
author: Sharon J.

description: Love this place!  Beautiful, clean aesthetic.  Delicious, hand-crafted drinks.  I had the roobios decaf iced boba tea with almond milk and it was amazing - by far the best I've ever had.  This place is definitely going to take off.
author: Amanda G.

description: They are exceptionally friendly and helpful.  The owner educated us on the different tea options and clearly has a passion for tea culture, made with good quality ingredients.  The place is very modern, clean and cool.  The teas are amazing!!
author: Pat D.

description: I stopped in to Steap Tea Bar for the first time the other day to grab a little afternoon pick me up.  I left thinking that Steap was the best tea bar in San Francisco, hands down.  First, they serve delicious, made-to-order tea using fresh, quality ingredients.  I had the Almond Milk Pearl and it was spot on.  Second, the customer service is above and beyond.  I had the opportunity of meeting the friendly owner, Emil, who is incredibly knowledgeable about the methodology of making tea, and is passionate about customer service.  Steap guarantees 100% satisfaction to all their customers, and Emil ensured that I was happy with my order.  Third, the space is modern and clean with plenty of seating, and they offer the convenience of free WiFi and power outlets, which is always a plus.  All in all, Steap definitely deserves a 5 star rating!
author: Glen K.

description: All other things being equal, this was probably one of my most disappointing boba experiences. Owners are unfriendly, arrogant and disrespectful. Any smart business owner would take the criticism and try to fix the issues--not deny they ever existed! But here, they are unwilling to attend to customer's concerns. You don't believe me? Wait till the owner responds to this review with how he has the best tea in town and that I should get my taste buds attuned to what he advertises as the best tea in town.
author: Jake M.

description:
Very friendly workers ! Place was nice and clean 
Drinks are tasty and very refreshing :)
author: Alex A.

description: Stopped by for drinks as we enjoyed our takeout Chinese food.  The service was outstanding and the folks were very friendly.  They made suggestions for my kids and we all throughly enjoyed our drinks!
author: Andrew N.

description: Very nice (and cute owner). Handmade, natural, mixology inspired boba teas. The matcha flavor is super intense and nothing like those weak ass powder teas. These guys will bend over backwards to make your drink perfect. The interior is also super modern and clean. Might not be what you are used to but definitely worth the change in routine for the boost in quality.
author: Athina E.

description: When I was there hey were playing Santana's Maria Maria and that was a definite up, and their drinks are good but i don't know why their drinks cost .50 more than other places and are much much bigger, also this was the first place that I saw a gender neutral restroom, whoa now that's what I'm talking about,S.F. slowly changing for the best!
author: Food F.

description: These guys are SUPER knowledgeable about teas. I wanted a milk boba tea but was unsure which one.  The tea-rista asked me a few questions and then agreed to make me a custom drink - a South African red milk tea with boba.  It was amazing! Great service and great drink!
author: Jesse K.

description: The tea and toppings were great, the pricing was good, and the staff is really nice and helpful. Went there with a friend, and both of us really enjoyed.
author: Gal T.

description: Love the ambiance and the Jasmine green tea! The owner is so personable and friendly!! So glad I came and hope to see you in LA soon :)
author: Sonia T.

description: Their Almond Milk Pearl is my fave! Their Roasted Green Tea is also really good! The owner and barista are super nice and accommodating. If there's something you don't like with your drink, they'll fix it for you for free. Highly recommend!
author: Amiel L.

description: Had walked by a couple times before realizing there's a boba place on this hill! I really enjoyed the tea we got here. My friend got the Pink Kitty while I got the Mango green tea. Both drinks were extremely refreshing, and boba was perfect. Drinks tend towards the pricier side, but with such quality tea, I think it's worth it. With such market saturation of boba places in the area, this place has a really unique style and although it's not the best, it certainly is an above average contender. Will be back!
author: V C.

description: Their milktea is really good!! I love the tea jelly but I really recommend they can get more people on making the milktea, 2 people is not enough at all. And if people think the waiting time is too long, they may not considered it next time.
author: Mary Meiyin W.

description: Can really taste the tea flavor! Love the almond milk. It is a bit on the more expensive side but you do pay for quality. Everyone is friendly and the place is clean.
author: Diana L.

description: The cashiers were so helpful. You can also ask for samples before you buy. Love the cleanliness of the store also! The kumquat green tea with hibicuis topper and classic milk tea was delish!!!!
author: Vy V.

description: This is the best milk tea I've had (roasted milk tea), and I drink milk tea at least once a week.  The ingredients taste really fresh, and pure.  I find most places make the milk tea way too sweet, even at "30% sweetness."  At those places, regular sweetness must be the equivalent of drinking simple syrup.  At Steap, I can taste they use a lot less sugar, and the flavor of the tea really comes out.  Very pleasant staff, super clean setting, delicious tea, highly recommend!
author: darren o.

description: The kids got the kitty drink with lychee jelly. It tasted fresh and you get $1 off for checking in. I turned around and gave it back as tip of course. This boba place appears cheaper than most.
author: Ravenous T.

description: A great new neighborhood spot. Highly recommend a make your own with rooibos and passion fruit (boba too if you're feeling crazy.)
author: Whitney T.

description: Accidentally destroyed the cup and got my drink all over the floor and they gave me a new one no fuss, pronto. Thanks (o:
author: Sameea B.

description: Steap Tea Bar is hands down the best tea spot in Chinatown! The space is amazing and their staff is super friendly! Plenty of open space, free wifi plus they hand make their boba! My go to drink is the almond milk pearl but they can virtually mix up any tea beverage you have in mind. Definitely recommend checking this place out on your next trip to Chinatown!
author: Chris R.
